lines.value: the cooum river divides the city into almost half and the adyar river divides the southern half of the city into two parts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the historic buckingham canal runs through the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is almost parallel to the coast
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 350 year old city still has much of its old charm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today it is a big commercial and industrial centre
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city has much cultural heritage
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the temples shrines forts and palaces of the city combine its past with the present
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chennai and its nearby area has been an important administrative military and economic centre back to the 1st century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many south india kingdoms like the pallava the chola the pandya and vijayanagara empires have ruled over the area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the british controlled the town in 1749
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: under british control the city grew into a major urban centre and naval base
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city grew up around the english settlement of fort saint george
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it slowly grew in the nearby towns and villages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chennai became the capital of madras state the india became independent in 1947
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the state was later renamed as tamil nadu is 1968
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chennai is connected by airways railways and roads with all the major towns of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chennai is linked with roads from rest of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the distance of major cities and towns from chennai are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chennai railway station is connected with all the major railway stations of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these include delhi mumbai calcutta ahmedabad bangalore cochin hyderabad lucknow and varanasi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the airport in chennai is directly linked to airports of delhi mumbai calcutta ahmedabad bangalore goa bhubaneswar cochin hyderabad port blair and pune
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the international terminal is connected with other overseas airports including london tokyo brussels singapore dubai frankfurt kuala lumpur and new york
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is one of the busiest airports in asia

lines.value: adware is an advertising computer program that can be put there by other people on someone's computer sometimes without their permission
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is because sometimes businesses put the program there so they can see what people are doing or what web pages they are browsing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they then put an advertisement that is of the same as the web page the person is looking at
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can be good if the person is trying to buy something but many people do not want advertisements
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people also do not want other people to find out what they are doing or what web pages they are looking at
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an example is in the popular peer to peer file sharing program kazaa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when someone downloads it it installs adware on their computer that then sends advertisements to the computer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people do not like this so they use an illegally changed version of this program called kazaa lite
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: removal tools have been developed to assist users in clearing out these unwanted programs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like many programs that people use for the program must be changed often
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: updating allows the removal tool to recognize new types of adware
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can be done by downloading files over the internet using the update option in the program
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a butterfly is a usually day flying insect of the order lepidoptera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are grouped together in the suborder rhopalocera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: butterflies are closely related to moths from which they evolved
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the life of butterflies is closely connected to flowering plants which their larvae caterpillars feed on and their adults feed and lay their eggs on
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have a long lasting history of co evolution with flowering plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of the details of plant anatomy are related to their pollinators and vice versa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the other notable features of butterflies are their extraordinary range of colours and patterns and their wings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are discussed below
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: angiosperms flowering plants evolved in the lower cretaceous but did not become common until the upper cretaceous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: butterflies were the last major group of insects to appear on the planet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they evolved from moths in the latest cretaceous or the earliest cainozoic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest known butterfly fossils date to the mid eocene epoch between 40 50 million years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like moths butterflies have four wings covered with tiny scales
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a butterfly is not flying its wings are usually folded over its back
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the wings are patterned and are often brightly coloured
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many different kinds of butterflies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the males and females of each kind are often slightly different from each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: butterfly watching is a popular hobby
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people also keep collections of dead butterflies that they have caught
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like all insects with complete metamorphosis a butterfly's life goes through four distinct stages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it begins as an egg which hatches into a larva a caterpillar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after some time the larva turns into a chrysalis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while it is in the chrysalis stage it becomes a butterfly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the butterfly then hatches out and lays more eggs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main predators of butterflies are birds just as the main predators of the crepuscular moths are bats
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also monkeys and tree dwelling reptiles are predators and some insects and spiders
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: certainly all reptiles and monkeys have good colour vision so that butterfly coloration works just as well on them as it does on birds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the extraordinary colors and patterns on the wings and body can only be understood in terms of their function
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the most obvious functions of color are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like most insects butterflies have three main body parts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these parts are the head the thorax and the abdomen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the body is protected by the exoskeleton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the body is made up of sections known as segments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in between the segments there are areas that allow the butterfly to move
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all three parts of the body are covered in very small scales
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the scales give the butterfly its color
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: butterflies have a very characteristic flying style
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they usually do not fly in straight lines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their style is well described by the children's version of their name flutter by
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some species are capable of strong long flights see monarch butterfly migration and others never leave the woods they were born in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they can survive bird pecks on the wings quite well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: late in the season damage to their wings can often be seen and still they continue flying quite well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the head is the first part of the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has the eyes mouth parts and antennae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the eyes of a butterfly are large
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the eye is made up of smaller eyes or optical units
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eyes that are made up of optical units are called compound eyes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: butterflies do not see as many colors as humans but they can see ultraviolet light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mouth of an adult butterfly does not have jaws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a kind of mouth that is made to suck liquids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this mouth is called a proboscis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the proboscis is made up of two hollow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tubes are locked together in the middle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the butterfly is not using its proboscis it is up in the head
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can uncoil the proboscis when it wants to feed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the antennae of a butterfly are used for smell and balance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the antenna in most butterflies is clubbed at the end
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some butterflies like the skippers there is a hook at the end of the antenna instead of a club
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the thorax is the second part of the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is made up of three segments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the legs and wings are connected to the thorax
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the legs of a butterfly are made for walking holding onto things and tasting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are three pairs of legs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are four main parts of the leg
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are the trochanter the femur the tibia and the foot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the end of each foot there is a pair of claws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: butterflies in the family nymphalidae have very short front legs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they keep there front legs close to their bodies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes it look like they only have two pairs of legs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some species there is a movable body part on the tibia that is used to clean the antennae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a butterfly has two pairs of wings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each wing has hollow tubes called veins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the colors and patterns of butterflies are made by tiny scales
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the scales over lap each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are connected to the wing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a butterfly is the tiny scales may rub off
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the abdomen is the third part of the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is made up of ten segments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the abdomen is much softer than the head and the thorax
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the end of the abdomen are the reproductive organs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the male there is a pair of claspers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are used to hold on to the female during mating
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the female there is a tube made to lay eggs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: butterflies go through complete metamorphosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that there are four parts in a butterfly's life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first part is the egg
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second part is the caterpillar sometimes called the larva
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the third part is the chrysalis sometimes called the pupa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fourth part is the adult sometimes called the imago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a female butterfly will lay her eggs on or near the food plant of the caterpillar the food plant is the plant that the caterpillar feeds on
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the female will choose a place to lay her eggs using smell taste touch and sight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most species will lay just one egg on the food plant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: others will lay groups of five to over 100 eggs on the food plant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most species will lay their eggs on the leaves of the food plant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: others will lay them on the flowers stems bark or fruit of the food plant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the eggs come in many different shapes and colors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they may be round or oval and flattened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some species the egg shell is
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most common colors in butterfly eggs are yellow and green
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the eggs will turn dark just before hatching
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also some butterflies take a day to come out of eggs while others could take months
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: butterfly caterpillars can vary in size color and shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they may have spines or soft body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all caterpillars have 13 body segments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first three segments make up the thorax
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the thorax has three pairs of legs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these legs are called true legs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the other 10 segments make up the abdomen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the abdomen has five pairs of soft legs called prolegs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the prolegs have tiny hooks at the end of the each foot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are used to hold on to things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hooks are called crochets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a caterpillar's skin does not grow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the caterpillar grows inside its skin the skin becomes too tight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in order for the caterpillar to grow bigger it its too tight skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the old skin is shed there is a new larger skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is known as molting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a caterpillar will molt four to five times before turning into a pupa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each part between molts is called an instar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all caterpillars can make silk
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the silk is made from the salivary glands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: silk starts out as a liquid in the salivary glands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caterpillar draws out the silk into a small thread
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the silk hardens as soon as it is to the air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: caterpillars use silk to make nests or cocoons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most caterpillars feed on leaves of plants or trees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most species of caterpillars will feed only on a small number of certain kinds of plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the caterpillar's food plant is not found it will to death
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some species of caterpillars in the family lycaenidae are by ants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caterpillars have special glands that make a sweet liquid called honeydew
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ants like the honeydew
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in return for the honeydew the ants protect the caterpillars from predators
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caterpillars also have special body parts that make sounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caterpillar will make sounds with the body parts and call the ants when the caterpillar is being attacked by predators
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ants hear the sounds and come to protect the caterpillar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: caterpillars in the subfamily miletinae eat insects in the order hemiptera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes aphids mealybugs leafhoppers and treehoppers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: p356 caterpillars in the family papilionidae have a special organ
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this organ is called an osmeterium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a bad smelling gland that is shaped like a snake's tongue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is kept behind the inside of the head
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a predator tries to eat the caterpillar the caterpillar will the osmeterium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this scares the predators away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the pupa plural pupae is formed after the last molt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caterpillar will find a special place to pupate pupate means to turn into a pupa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the digestive tract is emptied
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caterpillar sheds its skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the pupa is now exposed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caterpillar's tissues are broken down and rebuilt into the butterfly's tissues
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the pupa cannot move
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is attached to an object by tiny hooks on the end of the abdomen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these hooks make up what is called the cremaster
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many tiny holes on the pupa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they allow respiratory gases to move in and out of the pupa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many pupae are easy for predators to attack
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some caterpillars in the family hesperiidae and the subfamilies parnassiinae and satyrinae make shelters out of silk and leaves to protect themselves when they become pupae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these shelters are called cocoons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most butterfly pupae do not have cocoons to protect themselves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instead the pupae have brown or green colors to camouflage themselves among leaves and branches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pupae that do not have cocoons are called chrysalids or chrysalises
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some butterflies may be in trouble because of habitat loss
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of the destruction of forests and grasslands some types of butterflies have nowhere to feed and lay eggs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to help some people plant a butterfly garden with flowers having lots of nectar for butterflies to feed on
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people also keep plants that butterflies lay eggs on and enjoy watching the caterpillars hatch out and feed on the plant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chemical sprays that are used to keep pests away from garden plants also kill butterflies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: irrigation is when people add water to plants to help them grow when there is not enough rain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: irrigation water can be pumped from rivers natural lakes or lakes created by dams from wells or allowed to flow to the fields by the force of gravity along pipes or open canals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many different types of irrigation methods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most common ones are in sprinkler irrigation water is moved through pipes to sprinklers scattered around and within the field
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sprinklers shoot water from pressurized outlets or guns from pipes into the air which then fall on the plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: center pivot irrigation is a type of sprinkler irrigation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it's basically sprinklers on wheels
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in drip irrigation water drips directly to the roots of plants from pipes which have small holes or special emitters spaced along the pipe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: drip irrigation is more efficient than other irrigation methods because water is applied directly or close to plants roots i.e where it is needed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus it uses less water reduces leeching of soil nutrients and erosion of top soil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in surface irrigation water from a source such as rivers pipes dams canals e.t.c floods the soil surface
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: surface irrigation uses a lot of water compared to other irrigation methods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it could also drain nutrients beyond the reach of the plant roots
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the water is excessive it could cause damage to the plant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however surface irrigation is used extensively in rice farming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because the permanent flooding acts as a natural pest control method and rice can survive waterlogged soil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sub surface irrigation is when water comes from below the surface of the soil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sub surface irrigation create an artificial water table to place water right within reach of plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water seeps through the walls into the soil of farms from canals passing through and or around the farm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: drip irrigation becomes sub surface irrigation when the pipes are placed underground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with manual irrigation irrigation is done by humans using buckets pipes or watering cans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is labor intensive and inefficient
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: irrigation can let more crops be grown on the same land or allow a crop to grow in a dry period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is expensive and care should be taken to ensure that the benefits from increased crop yields are not exceeded by the installation and operating costs of the irrigation scheme
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: irrigation causes a subsequent rise in water tables
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if saline water is below it may rise to the surface
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes salinity becomes high enough to kill the plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: irrigation water itself can carry salt and sometimes other toxic materials that hurt the plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to prevent this irrigation projects must also assure good drainage
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magenta is a color in between red and purple or pink and purple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes it is confused with pink or purple

lines.value: in terms of the hsv rgb color wheel it is the color halfway between red and purple and is composed equally of red and blue 50% red and 50% blue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another name for magenta is fuchsia named after the fuchsia flower

lines.value: this colour is one of the three colours of ink used by an inkjet printer along with cyan and yellow

lines.value: the tragedy of hamlet prince of denmark is a play by william shakespeare
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is one of his best known plays and many lines have become famous quotations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the play is often just called hamlet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hamlet was written between 1600 and 1602 and first printed in 1603
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hamlet is a young prince in denmark who was supposed to become king when his father also named hamlet died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instead the throne was seized by hamlet's uncle claudius who also married hamlet's mother gertrude
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hamlet meets a ghost of his dead father who tells him that he was poisoned by claudius and demands that hamlet kill claudius in revenge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hamlet is at first not sure whether to believe the ghost so he tries to investigate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he pretends to be mad to hide what he is doing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the play goes on it becomes hard to tell if hamlet is actually mad or still just pretending
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his behaviour causes him to fall out with ophelia a girl he was in love with
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he eventually has the idea of getting some actors to put on a play of a king being killed in the way the ghost described

lines.value: claudius panics when he sees the play and hamlet realises his uncle is a murderer

lines.value: for instance in the united states of america each of the 50 states has a governor elected by its own people

lines.value: in australia and canada a governor represents the monarch in ceremonies

lines.value: in many countries such as pakistan a provincial governor is appointed by the central government acting as the ceremonial head of the provinces

lines.value: kidneys are two organs in the abdomen of vertebrates that are shaped like beans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they make urine the yellow waste water that comes out of the urethra they are part of the urinary system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when medical professionals discuss the kidneys they typically refer to the word renal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example renal failure is when the kidneys are sick and do not work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the prefix nephro is also used in words to mean kidneys
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example a nephrologist is a doctor who studies kidneys
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kidney makes hormones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the two most important ones that it makes are erythropoetin and renin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: erythropoetin is made by the kidneys if there is less oxygen in the kidney
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: erythropoetin tells the bone marrow to make more red blood cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so this means there will be more oxygen carried in the blood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: renin is made by the kidney if there is low blood pressure low volume of blood or too low salts in the blood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: renin makes the blood vessels smaller and tells the adrenal gland to make aldosterone which tells the kidneys to save salts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also makes a person feel thirsty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all of this makes the blood pressure go up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kidney's most important work is keeping homeostasis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: homeostasis means that the body keeps a stable environment inside itself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the body needs to have the consistent and proper amount of water salt and acid in the blood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kidney keeps these things constant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if there is too much water the kidney puts more water in the urine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if there is not enough water the kidney uses less water in the urine.this is why people make less urine when they are dehydrated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many types of kidney diseases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a kidney disease makes the kidneys unable to work perfectly but they do work in part
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people can have mild kidney failure and have no symptoms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as long as it does not become worse people may not even know they have it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: severe kidney failure means very bad failure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kidneys do not work very much at all
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people with severe kidney failure always have symptoms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they may need special care from doctors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main kinds of kidney diseases are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a person's kidneys do not work properly they are very sick
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if they have severe kidney failure they cannot live unless they have a replacement for their kidneys
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two ways to replace the kidneys dialysis and transplantation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dialysis is when doctors use a machine and medicines to do the work of the kidneys
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two kinds of dialysis hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: peritoneal dialysis is when doctors put a plastic tube into the person's abdomen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: every day the person fills the abdomen with fluid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the extra salts waste and water that the body does not need goes into the fluid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the fluid comes out and takes the wastes with it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this does part of the job that kidneys do.hemodialysis is when doctors take blood from a person clean the blood with a special kind of filter called a haemodialyser and put it back in the person
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the blood is cleaned water salts and wastes are taken out of it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this must be done 2 4 times every week usually 3 times it takes 2 4 hours to do this each time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis are not perfect
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they do some of the work of the kidney but it is not as good as a real kidney
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so people who need dialysis are not as healthy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they must take medicines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example in kidney failure the kidneys do not make any erythropoetin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: doctors have to give people erythropoetin so they make enough red blood cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a better way to do the kidneys work is to give the person another kidney
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called a kidney transplant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kidney transplants are the most common type of organ transplant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the most common because we have two kidneys but only need one kidney to live
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people who are alive can donate a kidney to another person
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even transplanted kidneys are not the same as kidneys people were born with
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a person who gets a renal transplant must take strong medicines to stop their body from attacking the new kidney
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes after years the transplanted kidney stops working
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but sometimespoooooooooo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was widely believed in europe that the conscience was actually located in the kidneys
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this idea was taken from the hebrew bible
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in modern times medical scientists have shown kidneys do not have this kind of psychological role

lines.value: the cytoplasm also known as cytosol is the protoplasm of a cell outside the cell nucleus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the gel like material plus the organelles outside the nucleus and inside the cell membrane
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many important functions of a cell take place in organelles which are like bits of machinery for doing jobs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cytoplasm is highly structured it is not some kind of soup even though it is made out of 7580% water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cytosol contains a complex mixture of cytoskeleton filaments including the endoplasmic reticulum and the golgi apparatus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it includes dissolved molecules and water that fills much of the cell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: due to this network of fibres membranes and the many dissolved macromolecules such as proteins the cytosol does not act like a simple liquid

lines.value: the flag of greenland was designed by greenlander thue christiansen

lines.value: its local name in the greenlandic language is erfalasorput which means our flag but aappalaartoq meaning the red is also used for both the greenlandic flag and the dannebrog

lines.value: today greenlanders display both the erfalasorput and the dannebrog often side by side

lines.value: greenland first thought of the idea of a flag of its own in 1973 when five greenlanders proposed a green white and blue flag

lines.value: the following year a newspaper printed eleven design proposals all but one of which was a nordic cross and polled the people to determine the most popular

lines.value: the home rule government asked for flag proposals receiving 555

lines.value: kgb is the russian language abbreviation for state security committee
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was the main internal security agency for the soviet union from 1954 until its break up in 1991
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was formed in 1954 as a successor of earlier agencies the cheka nkgb and mgb
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the cold war the kgb suppressed ideological subversion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this meant suppressing unorthodox political and religious ideas and the people who held those ideas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was soviet policy for the kgb and the secret services of the satellite state s to monitor public and private opinion internal subversion and possible counter revolutionary plots in the soviet bloc
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kgb was instrumental in crushing the hungarian revolution of 1956 and the prague spring of socialism with a human face in 1968 czechoslovakia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a record of some of its doings is contained in the mitrokin archive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from 13 march 1954 to 6 november 1991 kgb was the main name for the main soviet security agency intelligence agency or spy agency and the secret police agency
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in march 1953 lavrenty beria merged the mvd and the mgb into one agencythe mvd
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in december of that year beria and six associates were executed and the mvd split
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reformed mvd retained its police and law enforcement powers while the second new agency the kgb did the internal and external security functions and reported to the council of ministers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 5 july 1978 the kgb was renamed as the kgb of the soviet union with its chairman holding a ministerial council seat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kgb ended when its chief colonel general vladimir kryuchkov used the kgb's resources to help the august 1991 coup attempt to overthrow soviet president mikhail gorbachev
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 23 august 1991 colonel general kryuchkov was arrested and general vadim bakatin was appointed kgb chairmanand mandated to dissolve the kgb of the soviet union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 6 november 1991 the kgb officially ceased to exist although russia's new national security organisation the russian federalnaya sluzhba bezopasnosti fsb works in the same things that the soviet kgb did
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: belarus is the only post soviet union era country where the national security organization is still called kgb
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: belarus is where felix dzerzhinsky started a group called the cheka which was an organization in the soviet union before the mvd or the kgb was started

lines.value: the zip drive is a data storage device
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the company iomega published it in late 1994
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: originally it only supported 100 mb disks but later versions began to support 250 mb and 750 mb disks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now capacities have reached 1gb and 2gb disks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: higher capacity zip disks must be used in a drive with at least the same capacity ability
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: generally higher capacity drives also handle all lower capacity media
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it is slower to write data on a 100 mb disk with a 250 mb zip drive than with a 100 mb zip drive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: zip drives can transmit data to the computer in various ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internal drives have been made with ide and scsi interfaces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: external drives can use scsi parallel port or usb interface
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: zip disks are thicker than 3.5 9 cm floppy disks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nevertheless zip disks are quite similar in appearance to regular floppy disks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means the zip drive slot is large enough to accept such a floppy disk

lines.value: turkish turkce is a language is spoken natively in republic of turkey cyprus bulgaria greece and other countries of the former ottoman empire as well as by several million emigrants in europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: turkish is a turkic language and in altaic language family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: turkish has vowel harmony like finnish and hungarian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: word order is usually subject object verb sov
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: turkish used to be written with the arabic alphabet from about 900 ad to 1928
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however mustafa kemal ataturk changed it to the latin alphabet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the turkish government justified the move to the latin script as being necessary to increase literacy as the arabic script was much more difficult to learn
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the literacy rate did indeed increase greatly after the alphabet reform from around 20% to over 90%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the resulting latin alphabet was designed to reflect the actual sounds of spoken turkish rather than simply transcribing the old ottoman script into a new form
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the turkish alphabet is a latin alphabet used for writing the turkish language consisting of 29 letters seven of which c g i i o s and u have been modified from their latin originals for the phonetic requirements of the language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this alphabet represents modern turkish pronunciation with a high degree of accuracy and specificity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the current official alphabet and the latest in a series of distinct alphabets used in different eras
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this language is most closely related to other turkic languages including uzbek turkmen and kazakh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is another theory that turkish is part of a larger altaic family of languages which also includes japanese mongolian and korean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the plastic ono band was a rock and roll band formed by yoko ono with husband and former beatle john lennon

lines.value: lennon and ono recorded their first single together titled give peace a chance in a montreal hotel with a roomful of guests including tommy smothers allen ginsberg norman mailer timothy leary and the local hare krishna chapter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the pair were in an auto accident before the single was to debut be played in public for the first time and they had to stay in the hospital

lines.value: not wanting to cancel the debut they sent the first version of their new band - a set of plastic cases that held the sound equipment - which played in their place

lines.value: it was a strange kind of debut for a new band but the song a protest against the vietnam war became a minor hit that year in england and in the united states

lines.value: the second version of the plastic ono band included ono and lennon in person along with musicians eric clapton klaus voormann and alan white

lines.value: they performed together at a rock concert in toronto in september 1969 and it was the first time lennon had played in public with a band other than the beatles

lines.value: antimony is found as two stable not radioactive isotopes naturally

lines.value: interest is the cost for borrowing money or the payment for lending money
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually this is fixed as a percentage of the amount of money borrowed which is called interest rate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the interest charged on $100 is 1 percent per year then every year the borrower must pay $1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the $1 is not added to the amount owed then the borrower is paying simple interest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if simple interest of 1 percent is paid each year at the end of 100 years the borrower would have paid $100 in interest $1 each year and would still owe $100
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the $1 is added to the $100 the amount owed will increase to $101
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 1 percent interest on $101 will be more than $1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called compound interest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: compound interest will cause the amount to grow each year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the amount grows larger more is paid as interest each year and added to the total
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if compound interest of 1 percent is paid on a loan of $100 each year the amount of interest paid will slightly increase and after 70 years the amount owed will have grown to $200 and the interest payment will have increased to $2
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 1 percent compound interest on $100 will cause the amount to double to $200 in about 70 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is called the rule of 73 which can be used to figure out how fast something grows
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the rule can be used to figure out how fast anything that always grows exponentially at the same rate will double in size
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: suppose a kangaroo grows 10 percent a year dividing 10 into 70 gives 7 so the kangaroo will double in size in 12 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the kangaroo grew 7 percent a year it would take 10 years for its size to double
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if it only grew 2 percent it would take 35 years for its size to double
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at some times in the past or in some places today it has been illegal to make a person pay interest on a loan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was or is against some religious rules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the interest that a person must pay is too high this is called usury
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is often illegal today even when lower interest is legal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: interest can also be the care or concern that someone has for something or someone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if someone cares about something they have an interest in that thing or they find it interesting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if something is beautiful or funny or new that might make the thing interesting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however a very important concern for example love or hate is more than an interest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an interest can also be a task that someone likes to do or watch like a game or a hobby
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if someone has a legal right to something usually money or property they have an interest in that thing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is also true for someone who shares a right with others or a person who has a future right to something
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example if some brothers and sisters will be given a house after their parents die each of them has a financial interest in the house even if the parents are still living
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: psittacosaurus was a small ceratopsian dinosaur from the lower cretaceous of what is now asia about 130 to 100 million years ago

lines.value: it was more basal than other members of the ceratopsia it was bipedal and had no horns or frill on its head

lines.value: what made it a ceratopsian was its beak

lines.value: it is notable for being the most species rich dinosaur genus but there is no general agreement on these species

lines.value: nine to eleven species are named for fossils found in different regions of china mongolia and russia with a possible additional species from thailand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all species of psittacosaurus were gazelle sized bipedal herbivores with a high powerful beak on the upper jaw
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at least one species had long quill like structures on its tail and lower back possibly with a display function
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: firs abies are about 45-55 species of evergreen trees in the family pinaceae

lines.value: fir trees can reach heights of 10 80 m tall and trunk diameters of 0.5-4 m when mature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the difference between firs and other members of the pine family is that their needle like leaves are attached to the twig by a base that resembles a small suction cup and by erect cylindrical female cones 5 25 cm long that release the winged seeds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the male cones are normally much smaller and spread through the tree so that the wind can help pollinate the female cones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like all members of the pine family these trees have a sticky sap called resin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fir wood is not suitable for construction because it is not very resistant to insects and decay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is usually sawn or crushed into fine sheets or pieces and made into plywood or chipboard for indoor or temporary outdoor use
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however fir trees are used widely in gardening

lines.value: they can be used as shelter trees to protect other plants from wind or grown alone as decorative trees

lines.value: this means it is the same everywhere in empty space and does not change with time

lines.value: according to special relativity is the maximum speed at which all energy matter and physical information in the universe can travel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the speed of all massless particles such as photons and associated fields including electromagnetic radiation such as light in a vacuum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is predicted by the current theory to be the speed of gravity that is gravitational waves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: such particles and waves travel at regardless of the motion of the source or the inertial frame of reference of the observer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the theory of relativity interrelates space and time and appears in the famous equation of mass energy equivalence e = mc 2
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the theory of relativity is based on the prediction so far upheld by observations that the measured speed of light in a vacuum is the same whether or not the source of the light and the person doing the measuring are moving relative to each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is sometimes expressed as the speed of light is independent of the reference frame
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this behavior is different from our common ideas about motion as shown by this example george is standing on the ground next to some train tracks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is a train rushing by at 30 mph
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: george throws a baseball at 90 mph in the direction the train is moving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tom a passenger on the train has a device like a radar gun to measure throwing speeds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because he is on the train tom is already moving at 30 mph in the direction of the throw so tom measures the speed of the ball as only 60 mph
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in other words the speed of the baseball as measured by tom on the train depends on the speed of the train
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the example above the train was moving at 1/3 the speed of the ball and the speed of the ball as measured on the train was 2/3 of the throwing speed as measured on the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now repeat the experiment with light instead of a baseball that is george has a flashlight instead of throwing a baseball
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: george and tom both have devices that are the same to measure the speed of light(instead of the radar gun in the baseball example
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: george is standing on the ground next to some train tracks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is a train rushing by at 1/3 the speed of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: george flashes a light beam in the direction the train is moving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: george measures the speed of light as 186000 miles per second
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tom a passenger on the train measures the speed of the light beam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: what speed does tom measure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: intuitively you may think that the speed of the light from the flashlight as measured on the train should be 2/3 the speed measured on the ground just like the speed of the baseball was 2/3
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but in fact the speed measured on the train is the full value 186000 miles per second not 124000 miles per second
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it sounds impossible but that's what one measures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: part of the reason is that light is energy which acts and moves in ways very different than matter or solid objects such as a baseball
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: maxwell's equations predicted the speed of light and confirmed michael faraday's idea that light was an electromagnetic wave a way that energy moves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from these equations we find that the speed of light is related to the inverse of the square root of the permittivity of free space and the permeability of free space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a consequence of this fact is that nothing can go faster than the speed of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another consequence is that for objects that have mass no matter how much energy is used to increase the speed of an object it will get closer and closer but it will never reach the speed of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these ideas were discovered in the early 1900s by albert einstein whose work completely changed our understanding of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the index of refraction of a clear material is the ratio between the speed of light in a vacuum and the speed of light in that material
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ole christensen romer used an astronomical measurement to make the first quantitative estimate of the speed of light
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: <ref name=roemer> translated in as reproduced in ) the account published in journal des scavans was based on a report that romer read to the french academy of sciences in november 1676 cohen 1940 p 346
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when measured from earth the periods of moons orbiting a distant planet are shorter when the earth is approaching the planet than when the earth is receding from it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the distance travelled by light from the planet or its moon to earth is shorter when the earth is at the point in its orbit that is closest to its planet than when the earth is at the farthest point in its orbit the difference in distance being the diameter of the earth's orbit around the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the observed change in the moon's orbital period is actually the difference in the time it takes light to traverse the shorter or longer distance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: romer observed this effect for jupiter's innermost moon io and deduced that light takes 22 minutes to cross the diameter of the earth's orbit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another method is to use the aberration of light discovered and explained by james bradley in the 18th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this effect results from the vector addition of the velocity of light arriving from a distant source such as a star and the velocity of its observer see diagram on the right
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a moving observer thus sees the light coming from a slightly different direction and consequently sees the source at a position shifted from its original position
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the direction of the earth's velocity changes continuously as the earth orbits the sun this effect causes the apparent position of stars to move around
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from the angular difference in the position of stars it is possible to express the speed of light in terms of the earth's velocity around the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this with the known length of a year can be easily converted to the time needed to travel from the sun to the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1729 bradley used this method to derive that light travelled 10210 times faster than the earth in its orbit the modern figure is 10066 times faster or equivalently that it would take light 8 minutes 12 seconds to travel from the sun to the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nowadays the light time for unit distance the inverse of c 1/c expressed in seconds per astronomical unit is measured by comparing the time for radio signals to reach different spacecraft in the solar system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the position of spacecraft is calculated from the gravitational effects of the sun and various planets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by combining many such measurements a best fit value for the light time per unit distance is obtained
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: , the best estimate as approved by the international astronomical union iau is
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the finite speed of light is a major constraint on long distance space travel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: supposing a journey to the other side of the milky way the total time for a message and its reply would be about 200000 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even more seriously no spacecraft could travel faster than light so all galactic scale transport would be effectively one way and would take much longer than than any modern civilisation has existed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the speed of light can also be of concern over very short distances
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in supercomputers the speed of light imposes a limit on how quickly data can be sent between processors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a processor operates at 1 gigahertz a signal can only travel a maximum of about in a single cycle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: processors must therefore be placed close to each other to minimize communication latencies this can cause difficulty with cooling
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if clock frequencies continue to increase the speed of light will eventually become a limiting factor for the internal design of single chips
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: meat is animal tissue used as food

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word meat is also used for sausages and for non muscle organs which are used for food for example liver brain and kidneys
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the meat processing industry in some countries the word meat is to mean only the flesh of mammalian species such as pigs cattle etc but does not include fish insects and poultry

lines.value: beans and certain nuts are also high in protein

lines.value: people that choose not to eat meat are called vegetarians and those who do not eat any animal product are known as vegans

lines.value: some raw meat can make people sick or even cause death

lines.value: an anesthetic or anaesthetic is a substance that doctors use on people

lines.value: it makes them either stop hurting or go completely to sleep during surgery

lines.value: anaesthesia blocks the pain during operations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this lets patients undergo surgery and other procedures without the distress and pain they would normally feel

lines.value: it comes from greek roots an- without and aesthetos perceptible able to feel

lines.value: the modern anesthetic was created by joseph lister
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before it people sometimes used cocaine alcohol and other drugs

lines.value: modern anaesthesia is highly complex and often involves a combination of anaesthesia analgesia and muscle relaxation to enable physicians to do their part

lines.value: anesthesia can help not feel pain

lines.value: tenochtitlan was the capital city of the aztec empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aztecs built tenochtitlan around 1325 right on a lake called lake texcoco
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the empire grew so did tenochtitlan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the early 1500s at least 200000 people lived in the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this made tenochtitlan the largest city in the americas before christopher columbus arrived
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tenochtitlan was the center of the aztec government and religion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was also a very big trading center
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the spanish arrived in 1519 they guessed that 60000 people came to the market in tenochtitlan every day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people bought and sold many things there including slaves prisoners of war from states the aztecs had taken over
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the entire city was decorated with art architecture and stone sculptures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city had a huge pyramid called the templo mayor great temple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the top of the temple there were two small rooms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in these rooms the aztecs sacrificed people to two of their most important gods huitzilopochtli the god of war and the sun and tlaloc the rain god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aztecs believed that if they did not feed their gods blood the gods would wither and die causing the end of the world as they knew it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aztecs had created canals all across the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by bringing water to aztec crops these canals made it possible for the aztecs to grow much more food than they normally could have
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aztecs had also made levees to protect the city from flooding and reservoirs for fresh water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aztecs also built chinampas small rectangular crops floating on lake beds so that they could create more food to feed the thousands of people who lived around tenochtitlan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition they built waterways and dams so that they could receive fresh water and block out the salty brackish water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1519 spanish conquistadores led by hernan cortes arrived in tenochtitlan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cortes was impressed with the city but still decided to attack it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the spanish and their tlaxcalan allies invaded tenochtitlan and the city fell in 1521
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mexico city was built over the ruins of tenochtitlan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a railway track or railway line is a set of two rows of long pieces of steel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are used by trains to transport people and things from one place to another
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in america people say railroad as well as railway
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it means the same thing often there is more than one set of tracks on the railway line
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example trains go east on one track and west on the other one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the rails are supported by cross pieces set at regular intervals called sleepers or ties which spread the high pressure load imposed by the train wheels into the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also maintain the rails at a fixed distance apart called the gauge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ties are usually made from either wood or concrete
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these often rest on ballast which is a name for very small pieces of broken up rock that are packed together and keep the railway tracks in place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tracks are often made better by ballast tampers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the rails are inclined slightly towards each other typically on a slope of 1 in 20 and the rims of the train wheels are angled in the same way coning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this helps guide the vehicles of the train along the track
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each wheel also has a flange which sticks out from one edge all the way around
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes sure the train does not derail come off the track and helps guide the train on sharp curves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although homer seems selfish he does actually care for his family

lines.value: in one episode he entered lisa in a beauty contest so she could feel better about herself

lines.value: he is often heard saying d'oh which has become an often used word when things go wrong

lines.value: john locke (; 29 august 1632 - 28 october 1704 known as the father of liberalism was an english philosopher and physician
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his writings on the theory of social contract influenced voltaire and rousseau many scottish enlightenment thinkers and the american revolutionaries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his ideas are mentioned in the american declaration of independence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: locke's theories were usually about identity and the self
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: locke thought that we are born without thoughts and that knowledge is instead determined only by experience
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: locke's father who was also named john locke was a country lawyer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had served as a captain in the early part of the english civil war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his mother agnes keene was a tanner's daughter and was thought to be very beautiful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both mother and father were puritans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: locke was born on 29 august 1632 in a cottage by the church in wrington somerset about twelve miles from bristol
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was baptized when he was born
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after that his family soon moved to pensford
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1647 locke was sent to westminster school in london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during this time he was being sponsored by alexander popham a member of the parliament
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after finishing his studies there he went into the christ church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although locke was a good student he did not like the schedule of the time spent there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he did not like the classical subjects taught at the university and wanted to learn more about modern philosophy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: through his friend richard lower whom he had met at the school locke learned about medicine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: locke was awarded a bachelor's degree in 1656 and a master's degree in 1658
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1666 he met lord anthony ashley cooper who had come to oxford seeking treatment for his liver disease
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cooper was with locke and asked him to come
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: locke had been looking for a job and in 1667 moved into shaftesbury's home at exeter house in london to serve as lord ashley's personal physician
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in london locke continued his studies on medicine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: locke's medical knowledge was put to the test when shaftesbury's liver disease became worse until shaftesbury was about to die
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: locke used the advice of several physicians and persuaded shaftesbury to go to an operation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: shaftesbury lived through the operation and thanked locke for saving his life

lines.value: a tadpole or polliwog is a young frog that breathes and lives in the water

lines.value: there is enough food in each egg to last 21 days

lines.value: after a few weeks they begin to grow back legs then front legs

lines.value: soon after the froglets begin to breathe air and lose their tails

lines.value: they will grow larger and in a few months become adults

lines.value: most types of tadpole eat only plants

lines.value: some types of tadpole eat plants and animals even other smaller tadpoles

lines.value: during the tadpole stage of the amphibian life cycle most breathe by means of external or internal gills

lines.value: they usually do not have arms or legs until the change to adulthood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have a large flattened tail with which they swim by lateral undulation side to side similar to most fish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a tadpole matures it changes by gradually growing limbs usually the back legs first
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then it gradually loses its tail by programmed cell death apoptosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lungs develop at the time of leg development tadpoles late in development are often near the surface of the water where they breathe air

lines.value: during the final stages the tadpole's mouth changes from a small mouth at the front of the head to a large mouth the same width as the head

lines.value: most tadpoles are herbivorous living on algae and plants

lines.value: some species are omnivorous eating detritus and when available smaller tadpoles

lines.value: an elevator or lift is a vertical transport vehicle that efficiently moves people or goods between floors of a building

lines.value: they are generally powered by electric motors that either drive traction cables and counterweight systems or pump hydraulic fluid to raise a cylindrical piston

lines.value: because of wheelchair access laws elevators are often a legal requirement in new multi story buildings especially where wheelchair ramps would be impractical

lines.value: some argue that lifts began as simple rope or chain hoists

lines.value: a lift is essentially a platform that is either pulled or pushed up by a mechanical means

lines.value: a modern day lift consists of a cab also called a cage or car mounted on a platform within an enclosed space called a shaft or sometimes a hoistway

lines.value: in the past lift drive mechanisms were powered by steam and water hydraulic pistons

lines.value: in a traction lift cars are pulled up by means of rolling steel ropes over a deeply grooved pulley commonly called a sheave in the industry

lines.value: the weight of the car is balanced with a counterweight

lines.value: sometimes two lifts always move synchronously in opposite directions and they are each other's counterweight the friction between the ropes and the pulley furnishes the traction which gives this type of lift its name

lines.value: hydraulic lifts use the principles of hydraulics in the sense of hydraulic power to pressurize an above ground or in ground piston to raise and lower the car

lines.value: statistically speaking elevators are extremely safe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their safety record is unsurpassed by any other vehicle system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1998 it was estimated that approximately eight 100-millionths of one percent 1 in 12 million of elevator rides resulted in an anomaly and the vast majority of these were minor things such as the doors failing to open
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for all practical purposes there are no cases of elevators simply free falling and killing the passengers inside of the 20 to 30 elevator related deaths each year most of them are maintenance related for example technicians leaning too far into the shaft or getting caught between moving parts and most of the rest are attributed to easily avoidable accidents such as people stepping blindly through doors that open into empty shafts or being strangled by scarves caught in the doors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in fact prior to the september 11th terrorist attacks the only known free fall incident in a modern cable borne elevator happened in 1945 when a b 25 bomber struck the empire state building in fog severing the cables of an elevator cab which fell from the 75th floor all the way to the bottom of the building seriously injuring though not killing the sole occupant the female elevator operator
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while it is possible though extraordinarily unlikely for an elevator's cable to snap all elevators in the modern era have been fitted with several safety devices which prevent the elevator from simply free falling and crashing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an elevator cab is typically borne by six or eight hoist cables each of which is capable on its own of supporting the full load of the elevator plus twenty five per cent more weight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition there is a device which detects whether the elevator is descending faster than its maximum designed speed if this happens the device causes bronze brake shoes to clamp down along the vertical rails in the shaft stopping the elevator quickly but not so abruptly as to cause injury
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition a hydraulic buffer is installed at the bottom of the shaft to cushion any impact somewhat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most recently there was an incident in a modern cable borne elevator that took place in a children's hospital in seattle washington on october 9 2007
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the elevator involved was a thyssenkrupp isis machine room less elevator the isis used kevlar fiberglass ropes instead of conventional braided steel ropes all other traction elevators use
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of the isis elevators broke free from its cables slipping between the 6th and 4th floors the kevlar ropes were the cause of this incident
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the incident thyssenkrupp discontinued production of the isis and the following year replaced it with the synergy machine room less elevator which uses conventional braided steel ropes making it much safer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: past problems with early hydraulic elevators meant those built prior to a code change in 1972 were subject to possible catastrophic failure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the code had previously required only single bottom hydraulic cylinders
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the event of a cylinder breach an uncontrolled fall of the elevator might result
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because it is impossible to verify the system completely without a pressurized casing as described below it is necessary to remove the piston to inspect it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cost of removing the piston is such that it makes no economic sense to reinstall the old cylinder therefore it is necessary to replace the cylinder and install a new piston
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another solution to protect against a cylinder blowout is to install a life jacket this is a device which in the event of an excessive downward speed clamps onto the cylinder and stops the car
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this device is also known as a rupture valve in some parts of the world

lines.value: in addition to the safety concerns for older hydraulic elevators there is risk of leaking hydraulic oil into the aquifer and causing potential environmental contamination

lines.value: this has led to the introduction of pvc liners casings around hydraulic cylinders which can be monitored for integrity

lines.value: in the past decade recent innovations in inverted hydraulic jacks have eliminated the costly process of drilling the ground to install a borehole jack

lines.value: this also eliminates the threat of corrosion to the system and increases safety
