lines.value: there are at least four means of moving an elevator
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: *geared and gearless traction elevators geared traction machines are driven by ac or dc electric motors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: geared machines use worm gears to control mechanical movement of elevator cars by rolling steel hoist ropes over a drive sheave which is attached to a gearbox driven by a high speed motor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these machines are generally the best option for basement or overhead traction use for speeds up to 500 ft min 2.5 m s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gearless traction machines are low speed low rpm high torque electric motors powered either by ac or dc
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this case the drive sheave is directly attached to the end of the motor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gearless traction elevators can reach speeds of up to 2000 ft min 10 m s or even higher
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a brake is mounted between the motor and drive sheave or gearbox to hold the elevator stationary at a floor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this brake is usually an external drum type and is actuated by spring force and held open electrically a power failure will cause the brake to engage and prevent the elevator from falling see inherent safety and safety engineering
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in each case cables are attached to a hitch plate on top of the cab or may be underslung below a cab and then looped over the drive sheave to a counterweight attached to the opposite end of the cables which reduces the amount of power needed to move the cab
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the counterweight is located in the hoist way and rides a separate rail system as the car goes up the counterweight goes down and vice versa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this action is powered by the traction machine which is directed by the controller typically a relay logic or computerized device that directs starting acceleration deceleration and stopping of the elevator cab
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the weight of the counterweight is typically equal to the weight of the elevator cab plus 40-50% of the capacity of the elevator
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the grooves in the drive sheave are specially designed to prevent the cables from slipping
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: traction is provided to the ropes by the grip of the grooves in the sheave thereby the name
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the ropes age and the traction grooves wear some traction is lost and the ropes must be replaced and the sheave repaired or replaced
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: elevators with more than 100 30 m of travel have a system called compensation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is a separate set of cables or a chain attached to the bottom of the counterweight and the bottom of the elevator cab
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes it easier to control the elevator as it compensates for the differing weight of cable between the hoist and the cab
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the elevator cab is at the top of the hoist way there is a short length of hoist cable above the car and a long length of compensating cable below the car and vice versa for the counterweight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the compensation system uses cables there will be an additional sheave in the pit below the elevator to guide the cables
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the compensation system uses chains the chain is guided by a bar mounted between the counterweight rails
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a climbing elevator is a self ascending elevator with its own propulsion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the propulsion can be done by an electric or a combustion engine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: climbing elevators are used in guyed masts or towers in order to make easy access to parts of these constructions such as flight safety lamps for maintenance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an example would be the moonlight towers in austin texas where the elevator holds only one person and equipment for maintenance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many elevator installations now feature emergency power systems which allow elevator use in blackout situations and prevent people from becoming trapped in elevators
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when power is lost in a traction elevator system all elevators will initially come to a halt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one by one each car in the group will return to the lobby floor open its doors and shut down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people in the remaining elevators may see an indicator light or hear a voice announcement informing them that the elevator will return to the lobby shortly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: once all cars have successfully returned the system will then automatically select one or more cars to be used for normal operations and these cars will return to service
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the car(s selected to run under emergency power can be manually overridden by a key or strip switch in the lobby
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in order to help prevent entrapment when the system detects that it is running low on power it will bring the running cars to the lobby or nearest floor open the doors and shut down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in hydraulic elevator systems emergency power will lower the elevators to the lowest landing and open the doors to allow passengers to exit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the doors then close after an adjustable time period and the car remains unusable until reset usually by cycling the elevator main power switch
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: typically due to the high current draw when starting the pump motor hydraulic elevators are not run using standard emergency power systems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buildings like hospitals and nursing homes usually size their emergency generators to accommodate this draw
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the increasing use of current limiting motor starters commonly known as soft start contactors avoid much of this problem and the current draw of the pump motor is less of a limiting concern
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: elevators may feature talking devices as an accessibility aid for the blind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition to floor arrival notifications the computer announces the direction of travel and notifies the passengers before the doors are to close
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition to the call buttons elevators usually have floor indicators often illuminated by led and direction lanterns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the former are almost universal in cab interiors with more than two stops and may be found outside the elevators as well on one or more of the floors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: floor indicators can consist of a dial with a rotating needle but the most common types are those with successively illuminated floor indications or lcds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: likewise a change of floors or an arrival at a floor is indicated by a sound depending on the elevator
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: direction lanterns are also found both inside and outside elevator cars but they should always be visible from outside because their primary purpose is to help people decide whether or not to get on the elevator
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if somebody waiting for the elevator wants to go up but a car comes first that indicates that it is going down then the person may decide not to get on the elevator
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the person waits then one will still stop going up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: direction indicators are sometimes etched with arrows or shaped like arrows and or use the convention that one that lights up red means down and green means up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the color convention is often undermined or overrided by systems that do not invoke it it is usually used only in conjunction with other differentiating factors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an example of a place whose elevators use only the color convention to differentiate between directions is the museum of contemporary art in chicago where a single circle can be made to light up green for up and red for down sometimes directions must be inferred by the position of the indicators relative to one another
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition to lanterns most elevators have a chime to indicate if the elevator is going up or down either before or after the doors open usually in conjunction with the lanterns lighting up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: universally one chime is for up two is for down and none indicates an elevator that is free
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: observatory service elevators often convey other facts of interest including elevator speed stopwatch and current position altitude as with the case for taipei 101's service elevators
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mechanical and electrical design of elevators is dictated according to various standards aka elevator codes which may be international national state regional or city based
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: whereas once many standards were prescriptive specifying exact criteria which must be complied with there has recently been a shift towards more performance based standards where the onus falls on the designer to ensure that the elevator meets or exceeds the standard
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the national elevator standards include the american national elevator standards group anesg sets an elevator weight standard to be 2200 lbs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: additional requirements relating to access by disabled persons may be mandated by laws or regulations such as the americans with disabilities act

lines.value: coronary artery disease also called coronary heart disease is a heart disease
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: coronary means the blood vessels of the heart coronary heart disease causes plaque to build up inside the coronary arteries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this causes the coronary arteries to become narrower
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an artery is a blood vessel a tube that carries blood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the heart supplies blood that is full of oxygen and nutrients the arteries carry the blood to different parts of the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the coronary arteries are very important they supply blood to the heart muscle

lines.value: so when the coronary arteries become narrower less blood gets to the heart muscle

lines.value: most people with coronary heart disease can feel healthy for years before they start experiencing symptoms

lines.value: the most common symptom is a heart attack

lines.value: if coronary heart disease is not treated some of the plaques in the coronary arteries can break away and block the blood flow to the heart

lines.value: coronary heart disease is the most common cause of sudden death

lines.value: it is also the most common cause of death in people over 65 years old

lines.value: men are 10 times more likely to get coronary heart disease than women

lines.value: this can cause blood clots to form blocking blood from traveling through the arteries

lines.value: if an artery becomes blocked completely it causes serious problems

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it may or may not be true
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is called derogatory language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: terms like foolish stupid idiot and moron are insults because they say that a person's mind is not quick or smart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: insulting someone's mother directly is a serious insult in many cultures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ritual insults are part of many cultures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example they can be found in sports and military training
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are also very common in jargons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example the word newbie is a part of net jargon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calling someone a newbie is usually insulting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one should be very careful when using new words to describe others
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually someone insults others because they want to feel like they are better or have more power influence than the people they insult
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they may want this because they are actually afraid that they are worse or less powerful than the people they are insulting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when someone is insulted his or her pride is hurt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he or she may want to fight back by insulting the person who insulted him or her

lines.value: a university is an institution where teaching and research is done

lines.value: unlike the schooling they have done before the courses at university are specialized
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a person studying biology at university has many courses about biology and fewer courses in other fields such as languages or history
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to get a higher degree people must do some research
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the universities were born in europe during the middle ages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first institution of this type was the university of bologna that later became a model for similar centers of education
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this term can often be used in other cultures to mean centers of higher education and higher thought although their creation was often well before the middle ages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at first the universities had formed themselves according to the model of the professional groups and like almost everything in the middle ages they remained tied to the catholic church

lines.value: at the beginning they had worked to teach the so called seven liberal arts the trivium and the quadrivium

lines.value: a university can include several campuses or different places where classes are taught

lines.value: in each campus there are several faculties and university schools mainly for teaching and also laboratories departments and institutes of research

lines.value: the cold war 1946 1991 was the between the united states and its ), and the soviet union the ussr and its allies between the end of world war ii and the demise of the soviet union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the countries on one side were allied in nato whose most powerful country was the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the countries on the other side were allied in the warsaw pact whose most powerful country was the soviet union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the western capitalist group of countries includes western europe the americas turkey israel japan south korea thailand iran 1945-1979 pakistan malaysia philippines south africa australia and new zealand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the eastern socialist group includes eastern europe soviet union angola ethiopia cuba 1959-1991 mongolia north korea china and vietnam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the start of the cold war in 1947 was due to a belief that all governments would become either communist or capitalist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the western allies feared that the soviet union would use force to expand its influence in europe and was especially concerned that soviet agents had obtained information on making the atom bomb after the war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both groups of nations had opposed nazi germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soviet union had sporadically co operated with germany and shared in the division of poland in 1939 but germany turned against the soviet union in june 1941 with operation barbarossa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after wwii germany was left in ruins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the victorious allies that occupied it split it into four parts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one part was given to the united kingdom one part to france one part to the united states and the eastern part was occupied by the ussr
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city of berlin was also partitioned among the four parties even though the ussr had conquered it.the federal republic of germany bundesrepublik deutschland or brd was recognized by the western allies in june 1949
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from april 1948 to may 1949 the soviets blockaded west berlin which led to the berlin airlift
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ussr named their section of germany the german democratic republic deutsche demokratische republik or ddr later in 1949
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the western parts of berlin were called west berlin inside the ddr
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the berlin wall built in 1961 divided the two parts of berlin and was part of the iron curtain that divided europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: espionage spying has been around for a very long time and was extremely important during the cold war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after its successful nuclear espionage in the manhattan project the ussr built up its spy organs especially the kgb
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the central intelligence agency led us efforts abroad while the fbi did counterespionage
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: catching foreign spies was among kgb functions as well as fighting domestic subversion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the ussr the dictator joseph stalin died and nikolai bulganin and nikita khrushchev 1953 took his place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: khrushchev later took sole control of the ussr
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: khrushchev's secret speech marked a period of de stalinization and khrushchev tried to undo many of the things stalin did such as the gulag prison camps and cult of personality
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the united states there was a red scare and when the ussr detonated its own atom bomb there was a great deal of political fallout
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: famous people in many fields who had been communist sympathizers in the past lost their positions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many actors were blacklisted and were not hired to act in movies ruining their careers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: senator joseph mccarthy accused some important americans of being communists including some high government officials
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 1950s were the beginning of the space race between the united states and ussr
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it began with the ussr putting the sputnik satellite into orbit around the earth making the soviet union the first country in space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the united states responded by starting nasa and soon sent up its own satellites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soviet union also sent the first man yuri gagarin into earth orbit claiming that this proved communism was the better ideology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 1950s the united states under president dwight eisenhower created a policy called new look cutting defense spending and increasing the number of nuclear weapons as a deterrent in order to prevent the soviet union from attacking the usa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ussr also increased their nuclear force resulting in mutual assured destruction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the suez crisis of 1956 the cold war alliances were broken for the first time with the soviet union and united states favouring one side and britain and france the other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later that year the western allies did not interfere when soviet troops suppressed an anti communist revolution in hungary
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: united states vice president richard nixon engaged in several talks with nikita khrushchev during the 1950s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of these was the 1959 kitchen debate in a model kitchen in moscow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these debates highlighted the political and economic differences between the usa and the ussr
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the following year the united states u 2 spy plane crashed in the soviet union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tensions between the two countries increased
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the united states tried to invade cuba and failed bay of pigs the soviet union attempted to supply cuba with nuclear missiles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these missiles in cuba would have allowed the soviet union to effectively target almost the entire united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in response the united states sent a large number of ships to blockade cuba thus preventing the soviet union from delivering these weapons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the united states and soviet union came to agreement that the soviet union would no longer give nuclear weapons to cuba as long as the united states does not invade cuba again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was the highest period of tension during the cold war and it was the closest the world came to a nuclear war with possible global conflict to follow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the agreement that ended the cuban missile crisis relations between the two sides eased up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: several treaties designed to reduce the number of nuclear weapons were signed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during this period of detente the united states began building a good relationship with china a previous ally of russia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the policy of detente ended in 1981 when the us president ronald reagan ordered a massive military massing to challenge the soviet union's influence around the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the united states began to support anti communists all over the world with money and weapons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the idea was to help them overthrow their communist governments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soviet union had a slow economy during this decade because military spending was at an all time high
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they tried to keep up with the united states in military spending but could not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the soviet war in afghanistan starting in 1979 the soviet union had a difficult time fighting resistance groups some of them armed and trained by the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soviet union's failed invasion of afghanistan is often compared to the united states failure during the vietnam war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the late 1980s the new soviet president mikhail gorbachev made an effort to make an ally of the united states to fix world problems caused by the war with the ultimate aim of eliminating nuclear weapons completely
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however this did not take place because the president of the united states ronald reagan insisted on having a nuclear missile defense system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the people of the soviet union were divided on their feelings about this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some wanted president gorbachev to fight harder to eliminate nuclear weapons while others did not want him to be talking to the united states at all
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these mixed feelings created an atmosphere of political in fighting and the people were no longer united behind one goal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this the main bad guys the soviet union started to fight against each other the communist party started to crumble and the soviet union was destroyed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the fall of the berlin wall in 1989 and without communist rule holding together the countries that comprised the soviet union the ussr broke into smaller countries like russia ukraine lithuania and georgia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the nations of eastern europe returned to capitalism and the period of the cold war was over
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soviet union ended in december 1991
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not all historians agree on when the cold war ended
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some think it ended when the berlin wall fell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: others think it ended when the soviet union collapsed in 1991
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: modern paper is a thin material of mostly wood fibres pressed together

lines.value: the german language german deutsch or die deutsche sprache is a west germanic language in the indo european language family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is spoken in germany austria switzerland liechtenstein and luxembourg natively by around 100 million people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the most widely spoken mother tongue in the european union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are some people who speak german in belgium and in the netherlands as well as in france and northern italy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are people who speak german in many countries including the united states and canada where many people emigrated from germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in eastern europe too in bulgaria romania russia etc.german is a part of the west germanic language family a group of languages that are similar and is much like english and dutch
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a lot of the vocabulary in german is related to english but the grammar is more complicated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: german has a system of cases and when helping verbs are used the main part of the verb must be moved to the end of the sentence

lines.value: for example someone has stolen my car is jemand hat mein auto gestohlen someone has my car stolen or someone called me last night is jemand hat mich letzte nacht angerufen someone has me last night called

lines.value: in german writing every noun must start with a capital letter

lines.value: english and danish also did this long ago but not now

lines.value: today german is the only language that has this rule

lines.value: while german is an official language in switzerland the swiss dialect of german is difficult for native speakers from germany and even for swiss who are not native to speaking german to understand

lines.value: one reason why the dialects are still so different today is that even though switzerland adopted standard german mostly as a written standard german swiss in wwii wanted to separate themselves from the nazis by choosing to speak the swiss dialect over the standard dialect

lines.value: swiss german also has some differences in writing for example the letter b which is only seen in german is always replaced by ss

lines.value: dinosaurs meaning terrible lizards are a diverse group of archosaur reptiles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were the dominant land animals of the mesozoic era
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: over 500 different genera of dinosaurs are known
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fossils of dinosaurs have been found on every continent and there are still frequent new discoveries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dinosaurs appeared in the upper triassic about 230 million years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest date of a dinosaur fossil is that of eoraptor 231.4 to 228 mya
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the early jurassic they were the top land vertebrates and dominated most environments on land
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they continued until the sudden k/t extinction event 66 million years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from the fossil record we know that birds are living feathered dinosaurs also called avian dinosaurs because they evolved from the earliest theropods during the late jurassic period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: and so they were the only line of dinosaurs to survive to the present day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dinosaurs had adaptations which helped make them successful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first known dinosaurs were small predators that walked on two legs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all their descendants had an with the legs underneath the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this transformed their whole life style
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were other features
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the smaller dinosaurs had feathers and were probably warm blooded
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this would make them active with a higher metabolism than modern reptiles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: social interaction with living in herds and co operation seems very likely for some types
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first dinosaur fossils were found in the early 19th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are major attractions at museums around the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dinosaurs also became part of popular culture
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there have been many best selling books and movies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: new discoveries are widely covered in the media
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dinosaurs are united by at least 21 traits in their skulls and skeletons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these common characters called synapomorphies are the reason palaeontologists are sure dinosaurs had a common origin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however when definite dinosaur fossils appear early in the upper triassic the group had already split into two great orders the saurischia and the ornithischia

lines.value: the earliest confirmed dinosaur fossils include saurischian lizard-hipped dinosaurs saturnalia 232 225 mya herrerasaurus 230 220 mya staurikosaurus possibly 230 225 mya eoraptor 231.4 mya and alwalkeria 230 220 mya

lines.value: those dinosaurs which returned to four legged stance kept all four legs under their body

lines.value: a major change in outlook came in the 1960s when it was realised that small theropods were probably warm blooded

lines.value: it is now certain from fossils discovered in china see jehol biota that small theropods had feathers

lines.value: this fits well with the idea that they were warm blooded and that the origin of birds can be traced to a line of small theropods

lines.value: warm blooded animals have a high metabolic rate use up food faster

lines.value: they can be more active and for longer than animals who depend on the environment for heating

lines.value: therefore the idea of warm blooded dinosaurs insulated by feathers led to the idea that they were more active intelligent and faster runners than previously thought

lines.value: humidity adjective humid refers to water vapor in the air but not to liquid droplets in fog clouds or rain

lines.value: when the humidity is low the air can be said to be not humid or dry higher humidity reduces the effectiveness of sweating in cooling the body by reducing the rate of evaporation of moisture from the skin

lines.value: meteorologists have special devices to measure the humidity such as hygrometers

lines.value: humidity affects the rate of evaporation

lines.value: the mariana trench is the deepest known submarine trench
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also the deepest known location on earth itself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it lies south and east of the mariana islands and has a depth up to 10971 m 7 miles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the western end of the trench is near guam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the trench is about 2550 kilometres 1580 miles long but has a mean width of only 69 kilometres 43 miles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the deepest part of the trench is known as the challenger deep
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is named after the british royal navy survey ship hms challenger whose expedition of 1872 76 made the first recordings of its depth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a 2009 sonar mapping of the challenger deep from the kilo moana found a spot with a depth of 6.82 miles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sonar system has an accuracy of better than 0.2% of water depth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: water pressure is more than a thousand times as great as at the surface
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the challenger deep has been reached four times by submersibles namely the manned bathyscaphe trieste on 23 january 1960 the unmanned robotic deep sea probes kaiko japanese in 1995 and nereus u.s in 2009 and by james cameron in the deepsea challenger on 26 march 2012
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cameron was able to film a 3d movie of the bottom of the trench
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hms challenger expedition found radiolaria in the two dredged samples taken when the challenger deep was first discovered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on their 1960 descent the crew of the trieste noted that the floor consisted of diatomaceous ooze and reported observing some type of flatfish resembling a sole about 1 foot long and 6 inches across lying on the seabed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the report has since been questioned with suggestions that it may have been a sea cucumber
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the video camera on board the kaiko probe spotted a sea cucumber a scale worm and a shrimp at the bottom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the bottom of the challenger deep the nereus probe spotted one polychaete worm about an inch long
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an analysis of the sediment samples collected by kaiko found large numbers of simple organisms at
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the overwhelming majority of the organisms collected were simple soft shelled foraminifera 432 species according to national geographic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eighty five percent of the specimens were organic soft shelled forams
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is unusual compared to samples of sediment from other deep sea environments where the percentage of organic walled foraminifera ranges from 5% to 20%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as small organisms with hard calcareous shells have trouble growing at extreme depths because of the high solubility of calcium carbonate in the pressurized water scientists theorize that the preponderance of soft shelled organisms in the challenger deep may have resulted from survivors of the biosphere present when the challenger deep was shallower than it is now

lines.value: yerevan () is the capital and largest city of armenia

lines.value: the amount of precipitation is small amounting annually to about 350 mm 14 in

lines.value: as a centre of armenian culture yerevan is the site of yerevan state university 1919 the armenian academy of sciences a historical museum an opera house a music conservatory and several technical institutes

lines.value: the original company was created in 1919 by actors by d w griffith charlie chaplin mary pickford and douglas fairbanks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this group did not want to depend on commercial studios
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1967 united artists was bought by transamerica corporation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1981 metro goldwyn mayer and united artists merged to form mgm/ua entertainment co in 1985 turner broadcasting system announced it would buy mgm/ua
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then in 1986 mgm split from turner while keeping mgm's library of pre may 1986 films television and cartoons to make way for turner entertainment co and renamed to mgm/ua communications co in 1990 mgm/ua was bought out by pathe and renamed to mgm pathe communications
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1992 mgm pathe was bought by credit lyonnais and reverted back to metro goldwyn mayer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1997 mgm was sold to tracinda corporation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2005 mgm/ua formed the new company mgm holdings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the current united artists formed in november 2006
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was a partnership between producer actor tom cruise and his production partner paula wagner and metro goldwyn mayer studios inc from 2012 to 2015
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a fully owned subsidiary of mgm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2015 it was owned by dhx media until sold back to metro goldwyn mayer while handling ua's movies from 1952 to 2016
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however mgm decided to purchase united artists back from dhx
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they sold ua's stake to amblin partners in 2017 with newer movies produced by ua under a partnership between mgm and amblin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: united artists records was a record label founded by max e youngstein in 1957
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: . it was started in order to distribute records of its movie soundtracks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later the label began recording music of other types
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: robert college also called rc is an american high school in istanbul turkey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the most prestigious private high school in turkey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the institution was founded by cyrus hamlin with the financial help of christopher rhinelander robert in 1863 during the ottoman empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: robert college is also the first american educational institution founded outside the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was founded as a boys college for christian minority of the empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later the girls section was opened as american college for girls
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the muslims were allowed to be educated in the schools
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: huseyin pektas became the first muslim boy to graduate from college
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 19th century many additions were made to college including middle school and high school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the foundation of the republic of turkey in 1923 the school continued to educate young people who later became the leaders of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: prime ministers bulent ecevit and tansu ciller are among the school's graduates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1971 robert college donated one of its two campuses boys campus or bebek campus to the republic of turkey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a new public university was founded on this campus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the other campus girls campus or arnavutkoy campus has since been serving the society as a coeducational high school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * robert college
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * this article is the abridged and simplified form of robert college article on english wikipedia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the history of christianity is the history of the christian religion and the christian church from jesus and his apostles to our times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christianity is the monotheistic religion that is based on the life and teaching of jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christianity began in the 1st century ad as a jewish sect but quickly spread throughout the greco roman world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: despite early persecution of christians under the roman empire it became the state religion in the end
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the middle ages it spread into northern europe and russia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the age of exploration christianity expanded throughout the world it is the largest religion of the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the religion had schisms and theological disputes that had as result three main branches the roman catholic church the eastern orthodox churches and protestant churches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the first christians were ethnically jewish or jewish proselytes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an early difficulty came from non jewish converts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was the question if they had to become jewish before becoming christian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the decision of st peter was that they did not and the matter was further addressed with the council of jerusalem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the doctrines of the apostles brought the early church into conflict with some jewish religious authorities and this eventually led to the martyrdom of ss
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: stephen and james the great and expulsion from the synagogues
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus christianity got an identity distinct from judaism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name christian greek ) was first used for the disciples in antioch as recorded in acts 11:26 acts 11:26
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sources for the beliefs of the apostolic community include the gospels and new testament epistles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the very earliest reports are in these texts early christian creeds and hymns and reports about the passion the empty tomb and appearances of jesus after his resurrection
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there reasons to suppose that they were written within a few years of the crucifixion of jesus and came from the jerusalem church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christianity kept many practices from jewish tradition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christianity thought the jewish scriptures to be sacred and used mostly the septuagint edition and translation as the old testament and added other texts as the new testament canon developed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christians professed jesus to be the god of israel having taken human form and considered jesus to be the messiah christ who had been prophesied about in the old testament and so was expected by the people of israel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christianity also continued other judaic practices liturgical worship including the use of incense an altar a set of scriptural readings adapted from synagogue practice use of sacred music in hymns and prayer and a religious calendar as well as other typical features an exclusively male priesthood and practices fasting etc
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the time when most of the apostles had died and their jobs as leaders of the christian communities in the cities had been taken over by bishops is called post apostolic period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it includes the time of persecutions until christian worship was legalized under constantine the great
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest recorded use of the term christianity greek ) is from this period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the term was used by ignatius of antioch c 107
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: until the late fourth century when they became the dominant political force of the roman empire and by consequence the entire mediterranean christians were subject to various persecutions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this meant even death
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that was the case with stephen () and james son of zebedee ().
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: persecutions in lager scale by the authorities of the roman empire began with the year 64 when the emperor nero blamed them for the great fire of rome as the roman historian tacitus reported
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to church tradition it was under nero's persecution that the saints peter and paul became martyrs in rome
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: similarly several of the new testament writings mention persecutions and that they had very difficult times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for 250 years there were times when christians suffered from persecutions because they refused to worship the roman emperor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that was seen as treason and punished by execution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but the christian religion continued to spread throughout the mediterranean region
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: galerius issued an edict permitting the practice of the christian religion under his rule in april of 311
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 313 constantine i and licinius announced toleration of christianity in the edict of milan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: constantine became the first christian emperor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by 391 under the reign of theodosius i christianity had become the state religion of rome
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the emperor constantine i had learnt about christianity of his mother helena
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but it is not clear if he adopted his mother's humble christianity in his youth or if he adopted it later on in his life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when christianity was legalized the church took the same provinces for administration as the imperial government and called them dioceses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bishop of rome claimed to be the highest amongst all others and chose the title pope
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during this era there were several ecumenical councils
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these were mostly concerned with christological disputes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the two councils of niceaea 324 382 condemned arianism and produced the nicene creed to define the faith
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the council of ephesus condemned nestorianism and affirmed the blessed virgin mary to be theotokos god-bearer or mother of god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: perhaps the most important council was the council of chalcedon that affirmed that christ had two natures fully god and fully man at the same time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that meant that monophysitism was condemned
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the church in the early middle ages saw a transformation of the roman world rather than a fall of the roman empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the muslim invasions of the seventh century the western latin and eastern greek areas of christianity began to take on distinctive shapes and the bishops of rome were more interested in barbarian kings than in the byzantine emperors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this led to the coronation of charlemagne as emperor of the romans by pope leo iii in rome on christmas day 800
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city of rome was affected very much by warfare in italy during the early middle ages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: emperor justinian i tried to restore imperial dominion in italy against the gothic aristocracy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the following campaigns were more or less successful and the imperial exarchate was established in ravenna for italy but imperial influence was often limited
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then came the invasion of the lombards and rome had to take care of itself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus the popes out of necessity found themselves feeding the city with grain from papal estates negotiating treaties paying protection money to lombard warlords and failing that hiring soldiers to defend the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eventually the failure of the empire to send aid resulted in the popes turning for support from other sources most especially the franks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the high middle ages is the period from the coronation of charlemagne in 800 to the close of the fifteenth century which saw the fall of constantinople 1453 the end of the hundred years war 1453 the discovery of the new world 1492 and thereafter the protestant reformation 1515
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the investiture controversy also known as the lay investiture controversy was the most important conflict between secular and religious powers in medieval europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it began as a dispute in the 11th century between the holy roman emperor henry iv and pope gregory vii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the question was who would control appointments of bischops investiture
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the end of lay investiture meant an important loss of royal power for the benefit church reform as the pope intended and for ambitious noblemen as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bishops collected revenues from estates attached to their bishopric
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: noblemen who held lands fiefdoms hereditarily passed those lands on within their family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however because bishops had no legitimate children when a bishop died it was the king's right to appoint a successor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so while a king had little recourse in preventing noblemen from acquiring powerful domains via inheritance and dynastic marriages a king could keep careful control of lands under the domain of his bishops
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kings would bestow bishoprics to members of noble families whose friendship he wished to secure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: furthermore if a king left a bishopric vacant then he collected the estates revenues until a bishop was appointed when in theory he was to repay the earnings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the infrequence of this repayment was an obvious source of dispute
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the church wanted to end this lay investiture because of the potential corruption not only from vacant sees but also from other practices such as simony
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus the investiture contest was part of the church's attempt to reform the episcopate and provide better pastoral care
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pope gregory vii issued the dictatus papae which declared that the pope alone could appoint or depose bishops or translate them to other sees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: henry vi's rejection of the decree lead to his excommunication and a ducal revolt eventually henry received absolution after dramatic public penance barefoot in alpine snow and cloaked in a hairshirt see walk to canossa though the revolt and conflict of investiture continued
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: likewise a similar controversy occurred in england between king henry i and st anselm archbishop of canterbury over investiture and ecclesiastical revenues collected by the king during an episcopal vacancy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the english dispute was resolved by the concordat of london 1107 where the king renounced his claim to invest bishops but continued to require an oath of fealty from them upon their election
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was a partial model for the concordat of worms pactum calixtinum which resolved the imperial investiture controversy with a compromise that allowed secular authorities some measure of control but granted the selection of bishops to their cathedral canons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a symbol of the compromise lay authorities invested bishops with their secular authority symbolized by the lance and ecclesiastical authorities invested bishops with their spiritual authority symbolized by the ring and the staff
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the crusades were a military conflicts conducted by christian knights for the defense of christians and for the expansion of christian domains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: generally the crusades refer to the campaigns in the holy land against muslim forces sponsored by the papacy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were other crusades against islamic forces in southern spain southern italy and sicily as well as the campaigns of teutonic knights against pagan strongholds in eastern europe and to a much lesser extent crusades against catharism or other christian heresies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the holy land had been part of the roman empire and thus byzantine empire until the islamic conquests of the seventh and eighth centuries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thereafter christians had generally been permitted to visit the sacred places in the holy land until 1071 when the seljuk turks closed christian pilgrimages and assailed the byzantines defeating them at the battle of manzikert
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: emperor alexius i asked for aid from pope urban ii 1088-1099 for help against islamic aggression
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instead of sending money urban ii called upon the knights of christendom in a speech made at the council of clermont on 27 november 1095 combining the idea of pilgrimage to the holy land with that of waging a holy war against infidels
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the east west schism or great schism separated the church into western latin and eastern greek branches i.e western catholicism and eastern orthodoxy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was the first major division since certain groups in the east rejected the decrees of the council of chalcedon see oriental orthodoxy and was far more significant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: though normally dated to 1054 the east west schism was actually the result of an extended period of estrangement between latin and greek christendom over the nature of papal primacy and certain doctrinal matters like the filioque but intensified by cultural and linguistic differences
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the official schism in 1054 was the excommunication of patriarch michael cerularius of constantinople followed by his excommunication of papal legates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: attempts at reconciliation were made in 1274 by the second council of lyon and in 1439 by the council of basel but in each case the eastern hierarchs who consented to the unions were repudiated by the orthodox as a whole though reconciliation was achieved between the west and what are now called the eastern rite catholic churches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more recently in 1965 the mutual excommunications were rescinded by the pope and the patriarch of constantinople though schism remains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both groups are descended from the early church both acknowledge the apostolic succession of each other's bishops and the validity of each other's sacraments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: though both acknowledge the primacy of the bishop of rome eastern orthodoxy understands this as a primacy of honor with limited or no ecclesiastical authority in other dioceses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the western schism or papal schism was a prolonged period of crisis in latin christendom from 1378 to 1416 when there were two or more claimants to the see of rome and thus it was difficult to discern who the true pope was
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the conflict was political rather than doctrinal in nature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the renaissance was a period of great cultural change and achievement marked in italy by a classical orientation and an increase of wealth through mercantile trade
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city of rome the papacy and the papal states were all affected by the renaissance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the one hand it was a time of great artistic patronage and architectural magnificence where the church patroned such artists as michelangelo brunelleschi bramante raphael fra angelico donatello and da vinci
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the other hand wealthy italian families often secured episcopal offices including the papacy for their own members some of whom were known for immorality such as alexander vi and sixtus iv
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the early 16th century movements were begun by two theologians martin luther and ulrich zwingli that aimed to reform the church these reformers are distinguished from previous ones in that they considered the root of corruptions to be doctrinal rather than simply a matter of moral weakness or lack of ecclesiastical discipline and thus they aimed to change contemporary doctrines to accord with what they perceived to be the true gospel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the protestant reformation is so called because the movement's leaders protested against the ecclesiastical hierarchy and the pope essentially electing to institute their reforms separately from it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the term protestant however was not originally used by these leaders instead they called themselves evangelical emphasizing the return to the true gospel greek euangelion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the beginning of the protestant reformation is generally identified with martin luther and the posting of the 95 theses on the castle church in wittenburg germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: early protest was against corruptions such as simony episcopal vacancies and the sale of indulgences
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the protestant position however would come to incorporate doctrinal changes such as sola scriptura and sola fide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the three most important traditions to emerge directly from the protestant reformation were the lutheran reformed calvinist presbyterian etc and anglican traditions though the latter group identifies as both reformed and catholic and some subgroups reject the classification as protestant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the protestant reformation may be divided into two distinct but basically simultaneous movements the magisterial reformation and the radical reformation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the magisterial reformation involved the alliance of certain theological teachers latin magistri such as luther huldrych zwingli john calvin cranmer etc with secular magistrates who cooperated in the reformation of christendom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: radical reformers besides forming communities outside state sanction often employed more extreme doctrinal change such as the rejection of tenants of the councils of nicaea and chalcedon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: often the division between magisterial and radical reformers was as or more violent than the general catholic and protestant hostilities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the protestant reformation spread almost entirely within the confines of northern europe but did not take hold in certain northern areas such as ireland and parts of germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by far the magisterial reformers were more successful and their changes more widespread than the radical reformers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the catholic response to the protestant reformation is known as the counter reformation or catholic reformation which resulted in a reassertion of traditional doctrines and the emergence of new religious orders aimed at both moral reform and new missionary activity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the counter reformation reconvered approximately 33% of northern europe to catholicism and initiated missions in south and central america africa asia and even china and japan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: protestant expansion outside of europe occurred on a smaller scale through colonization of north america and areas of africa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: martin luther was an augustinian friar and professor at the university of wittenberg
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1517 he published a list of 95 theses or points to be debated concerning the illicitness of selling indulgences
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: luther had a particular disdain for aristotelian philosophy and as he began developing his own theology he increasingly came into conflict with thomistic scholars most notably cardinal cajetan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soon luther had begun to develop his theology of justification or process by which one is made right righteous in the eyes of god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in catholic theology one is made righteous by a progressive infusion of grace accepted through faith and cooperated with through good works
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: luther's doctrine of justification differed from catholic theology in that justification rather meant the declaring of one to be righteous where god imputes the merits of christ upon one who remains without inherent merit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this process good works are more of an unessential byproduct that contribute nothing to one's own state of righteousness
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: conflict between luther and leading theologians lead to his gradual rejection of authority of the church hierarchy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1520 he was condemned for heresy by the papal bull exsurge domine which he burned at wittenburg along with books of canon law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: john calvin was a french cleric and doctor of law turned protestant reformer in the second generation of the reformation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he published the institutes of the christian religion in 1536 later revised and became a leader of the reformed church in geneva which became an unofficial capital of reformed christianity in the second half of the sixteenth century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had great authority in the city and over the city council such that he has rather ignominiously been called a protestant pope
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvin established an eldership together with a consistory where pastors and the elders established matters of religious discipline for the genevan population
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvin's theology is best known for his doctrine of double predestination which held that god had from all eternity providentially foreordained who would be saved the elect and likewise who would be damned the reprobate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: predestination was not the dominant idea in calvin's works but it would seemingly become so for many of his reformed successors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike other reform movements the english reformation began by royal influence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: henry viii considered himself a thoroughly catholic king and in 1521 he defended the papacy against luther in a book he commissioned entitled the defense of the seven sacraments for which pope leo x awarded him the title fidei defensor defender of the faith
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the king came into conflict with the papacy when he wished to annul his marriage with catherine of aragon for which he needed papal sanction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: catherine among many other noble relations was the aunt of emperor charles v the papacy's most significant secular supporter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ensuing dispute eventually lead to a break from rome and the declaration of the king of england as head of the english anglican church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: england then experienced a period of frenetic and eclectic reforms some more radical and others more traditional under monarchs such as edward vi and elizabeth i and archbishops of canterbury such as thomas cranmer and william laud
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: what emerged was a state church that considered itself both reformed and catholic but not roman and hesitated from the title protestant and other unofficial more radical movements such as the puritans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the counter reformation or catholic reformation was the response of the catholic church to the protestant reformation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the essence of the counter reformation was a renewed conviction in traditional practices and the upholding of catholic doctrine as the source of ecclesiastic and moral reform and the answer to halting the spread of protestantism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus it experienced the founding of new religious orders such as the jesuits the establishment of seminaries for the proper training of priests renewed worldwide missionary activity and the development of new yet orthodox forms of spirituality such as that of the spanish mystics and the french school of spirituality
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the entire process was spearheaded by the council of trent which clarified and reasserted doctrine issued dogmatic definitions and produced the roman catechism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: though ireland spain france and elsewhere featured significantly in the counter reformation its heart was italy and the various popes of the time who established the index librorum prohibitorum the list of prohibited books and the roman inquisition a system of juridical tribunals that prosecuted heresy and related offences
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the papacy of st pius v 1566-1572 was known not only for its focus on halting heresy and worldly abuses within the church but also for its focus on improving popular piety in a determined effort to stem the appeal of protestantism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pius began his pontificate by giving large alms to the poor charity and hospitals and the pontiff was known for consoling the poor and sick and supporting missionaries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the activities of these pontiffs coincided with a rediscovery of the ancient christian catacombs in rome
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as diarmaid macculloch stated just as these ancient martyrs were revealed once more catholics were beginning to be martyred afresh both in mission fields overseas and in the struggle to win back protestant northern europe the catacombs proved to be an inspiration for many to action and to heroism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first great awakening was a wave of religious enthusiasm among protestants in the american colonies c 1730-1740 emphasizing the traditional reformed virtues of godly preaching rudimentary liturgy and a deep sense of personal guilt and redemption by christ jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: historian sydney e ahlstrom saw it as part of a great international protestant upheaval that also created pietism in germany the evangelical revival and methodism in england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it centered on reviving the spirituality of established congregations and mostly affected congregational presbyterian dutch reformed german reformed baptist and methodist churches while also spreading within the slave population
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second great awakening 1800-1830s unlike the first focused on the unchurched and sought to instill in them a deep sense of personal salvation as experienced in revival meetings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also sparked the beginnings of restorationist groups such as the mormons and the holiness movement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the third great awakening began from 1857 and was most notable for taking the movement throughout the world especially in english speaking countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the final group to emerge from the great awakenings in north america was pentecostalism which had its roots in the methodist wesleyan and holiness movements and began in 1906 on azusa street in los angeles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pentecostalism would later lead to the charismatic movement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: restorationism refers to various unaffiliated movements that considered contemporary christianity in all its forms to be a deviation from the true original christianity which these groups then attempted to reconstruct often using the book of acts as a guidebook or sorts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: restorationism developed out of the second great awakening and is historically connected to the protestant reformation but differs in that restorationists do not usually describe themselves as reforming a christian church continuously existing from the time of jesus but as restoring the church that they believe was lost at some point
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name restoration is also used to describe the latter day saints mormons and the jehovah's witness movement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fascism describes certain related political regimes in 20th century europe especially the nazi germany of hitler
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in his encyclical , pope pius xi declared that fascist governments had hidden pagan intentions and expressed the irreconcilability of the catholic position and fascism which placed the nation above god and fundamental human rights and dignity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fundamentalist christianity is a movement that arose mainly within british and american protestantism in the late 19th and early 20th centuries in reaction to modernism and certain liberal protestant groups that denied doctrines considered fundamental to christianity yet still called themselves christian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus fundamentalism sought to reestablish tenants that could not be denied without relinquishing a christian identity the s the bible as god's word viewed as the sole source of authority the virgin birth of christ the doctrine of atonement through jesus the bodily resurrection of jesus and the imminent return of christ
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ecumenism broadly refers to movements between christian groups to establish a degree of unity through dialogue
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ecumenism is derived from greek oikoumene which means the inhabited world but more figuratively something like universal oneness
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the movement can be distinguished into catholic and protestant movements with the latter characterized by a redefined ecclesiology of denominationalism which the catholic church among others rejects
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: concerning the greek orthodox church steady movement was made to reconcile the east west schism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 30 november 1894 pope leo xiii publishes the apostolic letter orientalium dignitas on the churches of the east safeguarding the importance and continuance of the eastern traditions for the whole church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 7 december 1965 a joint catholic orthodox declaration of his holiness pope paul vi and the ecumenical patriarch athenagoras i was issued lifting the mutual excommunications of 1054
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: concerning catholic relations with protestant communities certain commissions were established to foster dialogue and documents have been produced aimed at identifying points of doctrinal unity such as the joint declaration on the doctrine of justification produced with the lutheran world federation in 1999
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ecumenical movements within protestantism have focused on determining a list of doctrines and practices essential to being christian and thus extending to all groups which fulfill these basic criteria a more or less equal status with perhaps one's own group still retaining a first among equal standing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this process involved a redefinition of the idea of the church from traditional theology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this ecclesiology known as denominationalism contends that each group which fulfills the essential criteria of being christian is a sub group of a greater christian church itself a purely abstract concept with no direct representation i.e no group or denomination claims to be the church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: obviously this ecclesiology it at variance with other groups that indeed consider themselves to be the church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but moreover because the essential criteria generally consist of belief in the holy trinity it has resulted in strife between these protestant ecumenical movements and non trinitarian groups such as latter day saints mormons and jehovah's witnesses which are not often not regarded as christian by these ecumenical groups

lines.value: an amorphous solid does not have a definite geometric or crystalline shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a solid in which there is no long term order in the positions of the atoms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most classes of solid materials can be found or prepared in an amorphous form
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for instance common window glass is an amorphous ceramic many polymers are amorphous and even foods such as cotton candy are amorphous solids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an amorphous solid is any noncrystalline solid in which the atoms and molecules are not organized in a definite lattice pattern
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: such solids include glass plastic and gel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: solids and liquids are both forms of condensed matter both are composed of atoms in close proximity to each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but their properties are of course enormously different
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while a solid material has both a well defined volume and a well defined shape a liquid has a well defined volume but a shape that depends on the shape of the container
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: stated differently a solid exhibits resistance to shear stress while a liquid does not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: externally applied forces can twist or bend or distort a solid's shape but provided the forces have not exceeded the solid's elastic limit it springs back to its original shape when the forces are removed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a liquid flows under the action of an external force it does not hold its shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these macroscopic characteristics constitute the essential distinctions a liquid flows lacks a definite shape though its volume is definite and cannot withstand a shear stress a solid does not flow has a definite shape and exhibits elastic stiffness against shear stress
