lines.value: there are four common states of matter or phases in the universe solid liquid gas and plasma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the state of matter affects a substance's properties such as density viscosity how well it flows malleability how easy it is to bend and conductivity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a solid the positions of atoms are fixed relative to each other over long time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is due to the cohesion or friction between molecules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this cohesion is provided by metallic covalent or ionic bonds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only solids can be pushed on by a force without changing shape which means that they can be resistant to deformation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: solids also tend to be strong enough to hold their own shape in a container
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: solids are generally denser than liquids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: solid becoming a gas is sublimation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a liquid molecules are attracted to each other strongly enough to keep them in contact but not strongly enough to hold a particular structure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the molecules can continually move with respect to each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that liquids can flow smoothly but not as smoothly as gases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: liquids will tend to take the shape of a container that they are in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: liquids are generally less dense than solids but denser than gases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a gas the chemical bonds are not strong enough to hold atoms or molecules together and from this a gas is a collection of independent unbonded molecules which interact mainly by collision
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gases tend to take the shape of their container and are less dense than both solids and liquids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gases have weaker forces of attraction than solids and liquids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gas becoming a solid directly is deposition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plasmas are gases that have so much energy that electrons of an atom cannot stay in orbit around one atomic nucleus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the atomic ions and free electrons mix around like a hot soup
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because the positive and negative charged particles are not stuck together plasma is a good conductor of electricity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example air is not good at conducting electricity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however in a bolt of lightning the atoms in air get so much energy that they no longer can hold on to their electrons and become a plasma for a brief time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then an electric current is able to flow through the plasma making the lightning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plasma is the most common state of matter in the universe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both stars and the interstellar medium are mostly made of plasma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: phases of matter can be changed by a number of things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes pressure and temperature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a solid becomes a liquid it is called melting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a solid becomes a gas it is called sublimation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a liquid becomes a gas it is called evaporation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a gas becomes a liquid it is called condensation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a liquid becomes a solid it is called freezing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the freezing point and the melting point are said to be the same because any increase in temperature will cause it to melt and any drop in temperature will cause it to freeze
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is also the reason that the vaporizing and condensation point are the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many other states of matter can exist under special conditions including strange matter supersolids and possibly string net liquids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: scientist work on experiments at very high or very low temperatures to learn more about phases of matter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a substance reaches a high enough temperature and pressure at the same time called the critical point you can't tell the difference between very dense gas and very energetic liquid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is supercritical fluid and it behaves like both liquid and gas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: superfluids on the other hand only happen at very low temperatures and only for a few special substances like liquid helium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: superfluids can do things that regular liquids cannot like flowing up the side of a bowl and getting out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bose einstein condensates and fermionic condensates are phases of matter that apply to particles called bosons and fermions respectively
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more than one boson can exist in the same spot at the same time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only one fermion can exist in the same spot at the same time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bose einstein condensates and fermionic condensates occur at incredibly low temperatures about 4 kelvin which is the same as -452 fahrenheit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all of the particles in these condensates begin to act like one big quantum state so they have almost no friction or electrical resistance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the core of a star runs out of light elements like hydrogen or helium to sustain fusion the core will collapse into a very dense state called degenerate matter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: everything is packed very tightly and can barely move
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the star isn't too heavy it becomes a white dwarf
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a heavier star the pressure is so intense that even the protons and electrons are crushed and it becomes a neutron star
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the protons and neutrons that make up atoms are made of even smaller things called quarks which are glued together by things called gluons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at incredibly high temperatures over 2 trillion kelvin quarks and gluons turn into another state of matter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: humans can make a little bit of quark gluon plasma in the large hadron collider at cern but it doesn't last long before cooling down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his teachings spread after his death to central asia tibet sri lanka southeast asia and the east asian countries of china mongolia korea and japan and have now spread to the west

lines.value: the buddha's teachings are about suffering and how to overcome it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the buddha overcoming suffering allows a person to be truly happy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the buddha taught that if people make good decisions they would be happy and have peace of mind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the buddha taught that life is imperfect and that we will suffer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he taught that we suffer because of desire anger and stupidity and he showed that we could end our suffering by letting go of desires and overcoming anger and stupidity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the complete letting go of these negative influences is called nirvana meaning to extinguish like putting out the flame of a candle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the end of suffering when one is fully awake put an end to one's own ignorance and has let go of all desire and anger is also called enlightenment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in buddhism enlightenment and nirvana mean the same thing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buddhism does not say if gods exist or not but one can read many stories about gods in some buddhist books
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buddhists do not believe that people should look to gods to save them or bring them enlightenment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the gods may have power over world events and they might help people or they might not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but it's up to each person to get to enlightenment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many buddhists honor gods in ritual
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other buddhists believe the stories about gods are just there to help us learn about parts of ourselves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buddha is a sanskrit word which means the enlightened one or the awakened one the word buddha often means the historical buddha named buddha shakyamuni siddhartha gautama buddhists do not believe that a buddha is a god but that he is a human being who has woken up and can see the true way the world works
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they believe this knowledge totally changes the person
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some say this puts them beyond birth death and rebirth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: others think this represents the final extinction of desire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this person can help others become enlightened too
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to buddhism there were countless buddhas the one who is enlightened before gautama buddha and there will be many buddhas after him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in short he is not the first nor will he be the last
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first buddha in buddhavamsa sutta was tahakara buddha the mahapadana sutta say the first buddha was vipassi buddha however counting from the present kalpa the beginning of our present universe buddha gautama is considered the fourth buddha
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first is kakusandho buddha second konakamano buddha and the third kassapo buddha
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the last buddha of this kalpa will be maitreya buddha
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the universe will renew itself and from then begins a new kalpa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: old stories say that siddhartha gautama was born around the 6th century bc.he was born a prince and was unsure about if he wanted to become a religious man or a prince
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at age 29 he noticed pain and suffering
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he then wanted to learn the answer to the problem of human suffering or pain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he gave up all his money and power and became a monk without a home
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he walked from place to place trying to learn the answers to life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at last he gets enlightenment while sitting under a big tree called the bodhi tree
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the first person to teach buddhism to the people and buddhists love him for that
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a cutting was made from the bodhi tree and planted in sri lanka
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the original tree died a cutting from the sri lankan tree was planted in the original spot and so today there is a second generation clone of the first tree in the indian city of bodh gaya
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after siddhartha gautama died his students taught the buddha's teaching to more people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after a long time they wrote down the things that he may have said
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buddhists often talk about the three jewels which are the buddha the dharma and the sangha
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dharma is the way the buddha taught to live your life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sangha is the group of monks and other people who meet together like a congregation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buddhists say i take refuge in the buddha the dharma and the sangha this means that these three things keep them safe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they give themselves up to the community and teachings inspired by the buddha
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: seek refuge in what are often referred to as the three jewels or triple gem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are the buddha the dharma and the noble sanskrit arya sangha or community of laypeople and monks who have become enlightened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while it is impossible to escape one's karma or the effects caused by previous thoughts words and deeds it is possible to avoid the suffering that comes from it by becoming enlightened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this way dharma offers a refuge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dharma used in the sense of the buddha's teachings provides a raft and is thus a temporary refuge while entering and crossing the river
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the real refuge is on the other side of the river
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to one who is seeking to become enlightened taking refuge constitutes a continuing commitment to pursuing enlightenment and following in the footsteps of the people who have followed the path to enlightenment before
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it contains an element of confidence that enlightenment is in fact a refuge a supreme resort
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many buddhists take the refuges each day sometimes more than once in order to remind themselves of what they are doing and to direct their resolve inwardly towards liberation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although buddhists agree that taking refuge should be undertaken with proper motivation complete liberation and an understanding of the objects of refuge the indian scholar atisha identified that in practice there are many different motives found for taking refuge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his idea was to use these differing motivations as a key to resolving any apparent conflicts between all the buddha's teachings without depending upon some form of syncresis that would cause as much confusion as it attempted to alleviate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 11th century lamp for the path by atisha and in the subsequent lamrim tradition as elaborated by tsongkhapa the several motives for refuge are enumerated as follows typically introduced using the concept of the scope of a practitioner
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the buddha's first and most important teachings are the four noble truths
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the buddha told people to follow a special way of life called the noble eightfold path if they want to understand the four noble truths
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buddhists are encouraged to follow five precepts or rules that say what not to do
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the buddha taught that killing stealing having sex in a harmful way and lying are not signs of skill
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are the five precepts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the buddhist tradition all phenomena dharmas are marked by three characteristics sometimes referred to as the dharma seals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buddhism has evolved into myriad schools that can be roughly grouped into three families
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sanskrit term used for these forms is yna or vehicles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each yna sees itself as representing the true original teachings of the buddha although some schools believe that the dialectic nature of buddhism allows its format terminology and techniques to adapt over time in response to changing circumstances
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the three vehicles include first the hinayna or lesser vehicle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hinayana vehicle represents the class of practitioners who seek enlightenment for themselves and is represented in literature by those teachings that encourage arhatship rather than buddhahood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all traditions accept the hinayana teachings as being authentic and they are generally considered to be the earliest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however hinayana schools sometimes referred to as nikaya schools are those schools who recognise solely the hinayana teachings as authentic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the theravada school or way of the elders is the only surviving nikaya tradition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: theravada is practiced today in sri lanka burma laos thailand and portions of vietnam and malaysia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second vehicle is the mahyna or great vehicle which emphasizes universal compassion and the selfless ideal of the bodhisattva
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition to the hinayana scriptures mahyna schools recognize all or part of a genre of scriptures that were first put in writing around 1 ce
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these later scriptures are concerned with the purpose of achieving buddhahood through following the ten stages of the bodhisattva'a progress to buddhahood across three countless aeons of lifetimes because of the immense time many mahyna schools accept the idea of working towards rebirth in a pure land where the attainment of enlightenment is much easier
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mahyana is practiced today in china japan korea parts of india and portions of vietnam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the third vehicle is the vajrayna or diamond vehicle also known as tantric buddhism which while sharing many of the basic concepts of mahyna also includes a vast array of spiritual techniques designed to enhance buddhist practice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one component of the vajrayna is harnessing psycho physical energy as a means of developing profoundly powerful states of concentration and awareness
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these profound states are in turn used as an efficient path to buddhahood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: using these techniques it is claimed that a practitioner can achieve buddhahood in as little as three years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition to the hinayna and mahyna scriptures vajrayna buddhists recognise a large body of texts that include the buddhist tantras
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vajrayana is practiced today mainly in tibet nepal bhutan mongolia areas of india kalmykia and to a limited extent in china and japan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three months after the passing of gautama buddha the first council was held by the sangha
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at this point no conflict about what the buddha taught is known to have occurred so the teachings were divided into various parts and each was assigned to an elder and his pupils to commit to memory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these groups of people often cross checked with each other to ensure that no omissions or additions were made
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the second council one hundred years later it was not the dharma that was called into question but the monks code of rules or vinaya
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this resulted in the formation of the sthaviravadin and mahasanghika schools
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: opinions differ on the cause of the split the sthaviravadins described their opponents as lax monks who had ceased to follow all the vinaya rules while the mahasanghikas argued that the buddha had never intended a rigid adherence to all the minor rules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after this initial division more were to follow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schism in early buddhism was typically not on points of doctrine orthodoxy but in the area of practice orthopraxy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so if two schools shared a vinaya but were in dispute over doctrinal matters it was not unlikely that they would continue to practice together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however if one group disputed the vinaya of another this would often prevent common practice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 3rd century bc the third council occurred where small sects called into to question not only the vinaya but the details of the dharma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chairman of the council moggaliputta tissa compiled a book called the kathavatthu which was meant to refute the heretical false views and theories held by some sects
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: moggaliputta's views were of course disputed by his opponents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the version of the scriptures that had been established at the third council including the vinaya and the abhidhamma commentaries was taken to sri lanka by the son of emperor ashoka
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there it was eventually committed to writing in the pali language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the pali canon remains the only complete set of nikaya scriptures to survive although fragments of other versions exist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between the 1st century bc to the 1st century ad the terms mahayana and hinayana were first used in writing in for example the lotus sutra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during and after the 2nd century ad versions of the mahayana vision became clearly defined in the works of nagarjuna asanga shantideva ashvagosha and vasubandhu
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: around the 1st century ad buddhism spread from india through successive waves of merchants and pilgrims
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it reached as far as arabia to the west and eastward to southeast asia where the first records of buddhism date from around 400ad
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mahayana buddhism established a major regional center in what is today afghanistan and from there it spread to china korea mongolia and japan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 475 the indian monk bodhidharma travelled to china and established the became the east asian zen school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the first millennium ad monks from china such as yijing and xuanzang made pilgrimages to india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at one time different turkic and tocharian groups along the northern fringe of east turkestan modern xinjiang in western china adhered to the theravada school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however buddhism there was supplanted by the introduction of islam around 1000 ad.vajrayana also evolved at this stage carried from india to tibet around 800 ad by teachers such as padmasambhava and atisha
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there it initially coexisted with native belief systems such as bon but later came to largely supplant or absorb them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an early form of esoteric vajrayana known as shingon was also transmitted by the priest kukai to japan where it continues to be practiced
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is still an active debate as to whether or not tantrism was initially developed within buddhism or hinduism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buddhist literature tends to predate the later puranic tantras and there is some evidence to suggest that the basic structure of tantra depends upon the mahayana buddhist philosophical schools
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: see also timeline of buddhism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the buddhist canon of scripture is known in sanskrit as the tripiaka and in pli as the tipiaka
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these terms literally mean three baskets and refers to the three main divisions of the canon which are the appearance of the [[mahayana|]] tradition brought with it a collection of new texts composed in buddhist hybrid sanskrit many of which were also described as actual sermons of the buddha
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these include the perfection of wisdom sutras the avatasaka the lotus sutra the vimalakrti sutra and the irvana sutra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of the mahayana sutras were translated into tibetan and classical chinese and are also now read in the west
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the canon further expanded after buddhism was transmitted to china where the existing texts were translated and new texts were composed for the purpose of adapting the indian tradition to the east asian philosophical mindset
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of these works are considered by modern scholars to be spurious
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other new texts such as the platform sutra and the sutra of perfect enlightenment did not pretend to be of indian origin but were widely accepted as valid scriptures on their own merits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later writings include the linji lu of chan master linji
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the course of the development of korean buddhism and japanese buddhism further important texts were composed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these included for example in korea some of the writings of jinul and in japan works such as dogen's shobogenzo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: arguably the most thorough compilation of mahayana sutras is found in the tibetan canon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is split into those texts attributed to be authored by the buddha kanjur and those texts which are understood to be commentaries by indian practitioners tenjur
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vajrayna practitioners also study distinctive texts such as the buddhist tantras
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: recently an important archaeological discovery was made consisting of the earliest known buddhist manuscripts recovered from somewhere near ancient gandhara in northwest pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these fragments written on birch bark are dated to the 1st century and have been compared to the dead sea scrolls in importance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: donated to the british library in 1994 they are now are being studied in a joint project at the university of washington early buddhist manuscripts project
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some hindus believe that gautama is the 9th incarnation of vishnu and in the religion of shintoism he is seen as a kami
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the baha'i faith states he was an independent manifestation of god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: siddhartha gautama is thought to have been sanctified by the roman catholic church as saint josaphat based on a mistaken account of his conversion to christianity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some muslims believe that gautama buddha is dhul kifl one of the prophets mentioned in the qur'an
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to statistics from adherents.com estimates of the number of buddhists vary between 230 and 500 million with 350 million as the most commonly cited figure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in northern asia [[mahayana|]] remains the most common form of buddhism in china japan korea and vietnam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: theravda predominates in most of southeast asia including burma cambodia laos and thailand as well as sri lanka
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vajrayna is predominant in tibet mongolia and portions of india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while in the west buddhism is often seen an as exotic and progressive in the east buddhism is regarded as familiar and part of the establishment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buddhist organizations in asia frequently are well funded and enjoy support from the wealthy and influential
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some cases this has led critics to charge that certain monks and organizations are too closely associated with powerful and are neglecting their duties to the poor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the latter half of the 1800s buddhism along with many other of the world's religions and philosophies came to the attention of western intellectuals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these included the pessimistic german philosopher schopenhauer and the american philosopher henry david thoreau who translated a buddhist sutra from french into english
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spiritual enthusiasts enjoyed what they saw as the exotic and mystical tone of the asian traditions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at first western buddhology was hampered by poor translations often translations of translations but soon western scholars began to learn asian languages and translate asian texts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1899 gordon douglas became the first westerner to be ordained as a buddhist monk
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first buddhists to arrive in the united states were chinese

lines.value: hired as cheap labor for the railroads and other expanding industries they established temples in their settlements along the rail lines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cultural reevaluations of the hippie generation in the late 1960s and early 1970s included a renewed interest in buddhism proclaimed by some of them as a natural path to awareness and enlightenment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people including celebrities traveled to asia in pursuit of gurus and ancient wisdom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: buddhism had become the fastest growing religion in australia and many other western nations by the 1990s in contrast to the steady decline of traditional western beliefs see christianity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a distinctive feature of buddhism in the west has been the emergence of groups that while drawing on traditional buddhism attempt to create a new form of non sectarian buddhist practice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: examples include the shambala movement founded by chogyam_trungpa and the friends of the western buddhist order founded by sangharakshita

lines.value: a beach is a landform along the coast of an ocean sea lake or river
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it usually consists of loose particles such as sand gravel shingle or pebbles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the particles of a beach are sometimes biological in origin such as mollusc shells or bits of coral
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: beaches are natural landing and launching places for boats and landing craft specially made for beaches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people often use beaches as a place to swim to work on their tan or just to relax
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most popular beaches have fine white or light colored sand and warm water to swim in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: beaches may also be popular because of the excellent opportunities for diving or for seeing marine life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: among the world's most popular and well known beaches are aruba dutch caribbean long beach canada copacabana beach brazil hot water beach new zealand megan bay st thomas kailua beach hawaii zandvoort beach netherlands jeffreys bay south africa and bondi beach australia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was tourism made possible by the industrial revolution

lines.value: whole seaside resort towns grew to support visitors where before there were just villages

lines.value: vacations at the sea became common all over the world

lines.value: beaches are never static

lines.value: they are always being built up or eroded more quickly than other landforms

lines.value: over time the boundary between the land and the sea changes

lines.value: a fixed wing aircraft is a kind of aircraft
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an aircraft is a machine that can fly but is heavier than air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fixed wing aircraft are sometimes called airplanes aeroplanes or sometimes just planes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all fixed wing aircraft have wings that use forward airspeed to generate lift
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gliders are fixed wing aircraft that do not have engines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a steam powered unmanned fixed wing aircraft that weighed 9 lbs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 4 kg was built by john stringfellow in chard somerset england in 1848
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it could fly by itself without needing to be dropped from high up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were gliders before this but they had to fly by being pushed off a building or hill
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first man who flew took off steered and landed a motor powered aircraft was orville wright in 1903 in kitty hawk north carolina usa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today fixed wing aircraft fly between many cities all over the world carrying people and cargo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: big cities usually have an international airport where large fixed wing aircraft can land and take off safely
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some large cities like new york city and london have more than one airport
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two major makers of fixed wing aircraft are airbus and boeing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: advances in technology have made fixed wing aircraft more efficient
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: things like winglets and more efficient turbofans have helped to do this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most fixed wing aircraft have certain parts in common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fixed wing aircraft have long been used for moving people from place to place for things like holidays
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also carry cargo or boxes across seas and long distances to other countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first aircraft for war bombing was used in libya in 1911 by italy against the ottoman empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some fixed wing aircraft are used by air forces to defend countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these fixed wing aircraft may be fighters using guns or missiles for combat with other aircraft or they may be bombers dropping bombs on ground targets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fixed wing aircraft allow people to travel longer distances and faster than ships or trains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aircraft can fly from new york to london in about 7 hours
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it would take one week or more on a ship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: airplanes are also used by the military to see many things on the ground easily
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called surveillance or reconnaissance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: often fixed wing aircraft will take photographs as well which can be used for military planning later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: statistics show that riding in a plane is safer than driving in a car

lines.value: pakistan is a country in southern asia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is next to india iran afghanistan and china
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is officially called the islamic republic of pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a long coastline along the arabian sea in the south
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan has the fifth largest population 207.77 million in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan has a total land area of including the pakistani administered territories of azad kashmir and gilgit baltistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes pakistan the 34th largest country in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan has the seventh largest army in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the capital of pakistan is islamabad
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before 1960 it was karachi which is now the country's largest city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name pakistan means land of the pure in persian and urdu
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name pakistan ( english pronunciation or ; ) means land of the spiritually pure in both urdu and persian languages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many south central asian states and regions end with the element stan such as afghanistan pakistan baluchistan kurdistan and turkistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this stan is formed from the iranian root *sta to stand stay and means place where one stays home country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: iranian peoples have been the principal inhabitants of the various geographical region of the ancient persian empires now occupied by the states for over a thousand years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the names are compounds of stan and the name of the peoples living there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan is a bit of an exception its name was coined on the 28th january 1933 as by choudhary rahmat ali a pakistan movement activist who published it in his paper now or never
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by using the suffix istan from baluchistan preceded by the initial letters of punjab afghania kashmir and sindh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name is actually an acronym that stands for the thirty million muslim brethren who lived in pakstan by which we mean the five northern units of india viz punjab afghan province kashmir sind and baluchistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the letter i was incorporated to ease pronunciation and forms the linguistically correct and meaningful name
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most notably interestingly a word almost identical in form etymology and meaning to the iranian suffix stan is found in polish which has a word stan meaning state in the senses of both polity and condition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be found in the example of a polish name for the united states of america stany zjednoczone ameryki literally states united of america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan has a federal parliamentary system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the head of state is an indirectly elected president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the president is also the commander in chief of the joint armed forces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the head of government is the prime minister who is also indirectly elected
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the president's appointment and term are constitutionally independent of the prime minister's term
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the electoral college of the country composed of the senate the national assembly and the four provincial assemblies chooses a leadership representing the president of pakistan for a five year term
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the prime minister is usually the leader of the largest party in the national assembly and is assisted by a cabinet of ministers drawn from both chambers of the federal legislature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan is officially a federal republic but during a long period in its history it changed to a democratic state and a military dictatorship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: military dictators include ayub khan in the 1960s general zia ul haq in the 1980s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan's two largest political parties are the pakistan people's party and the government party muslim league pakistan which have military support
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the pakistan tehreek e insaf has also gained prominence in the past years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 27 december 2007 the leader of the pakistan peoples party benazir bhutto was assassinated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reason is yet to be determined
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan is made up of four provinces two territories and two special areas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both special areas are in kashmir
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the provinces and territories were divided into 26 divisions with now 147 districts directly divided from the provinces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each district is divided into several tehsils and each tehsil is divided into several union councils
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are around 596 tehsils and over 6000 union councils in pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: provinces balochistan and khyber pakhtunkhwa also have provincially administered tribal areas pata which are going to be regular districts territories <ol start=5> islamabad capital territory federally administered tribal areas administrative areas pakistan-administered kashmir <ol start=7> azad kashmir gilgit baltistan india pakistan and china separately control parts of the kashmir region
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: india and pakistan's parts are divided by a line of control
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the pakistan china border is internationally recognised
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: trade is common between the 2 countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan has a semi industrialized economy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the growth poles of the pakistani economy are situated along the indus river
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: diversified economies of karachi and punjab's urban centres coexist with less developed areas in other parts of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: despite being a very poor country in 1947 pakistan's economic growth rate has been better than the global average during the subsequent four decades but imprudent policies led to a slowdown in the late 1990s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: recently wide ranging economic reforms have resulted in a stronger economic outlook and accelerated growth especially in the manufacturing and financial services sectors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the 1990s there has been great improvement in the foreign exchange market position and rapid growth in hard currency reserves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 2005 estimate of foreign debt was close to us$40 billion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however this decreased with help from the international monetary fund and significant debt relief from the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan's gross domestic product as measured by purchasing power parity is estimated to be $475.4 billion while its per capita income stands at $2942
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the poverty rate in pakistan is estimated to be between 23% and 28%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan became independent in 1946 from the indian empire of british raj
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first people in ancient pakistan lived 9000 years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these people were the ones who made up the indus valley civilization which is one of the oldest civilizations on earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after that the vedic period came
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this also included parts of north western republic of india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: until 1971 pakistan also included an area in the north east india region
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is now called bangladesh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it lost that area after a war with the indian army and the joint militant group of indo bangladeshi alliance of mitro bahini of west bengal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during recent times pakistan has been in the centre of world politics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is first because of its support to guerillas in afghanistan following soviet invasion 1979 and later during the 1990s because of its cooperation with and support for the taliban regime in afghanistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however since 2000 pakistan has basically supported the west in their war against fundamentalist terrorism including the removal of the taliban regime in afghanistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan is a member of the commonwealth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however after the war in east pakistan the country was excluded between 1972-1989
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was also a member between 1999 and 2007 it was excluded in 2007 for a time but again became a member in 2008
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many earthquakes in the area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earthquake in 2005 with its earthquake center in kashmir is the strongest so far
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: over 100000 people were killed or wounded on october 8 2005
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan covers approximately equalling the combined land areas of france and the united kingdom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its eastern regions are located on the indian plate and the western and northern regions on the iranian plateau and eurasian landplate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: apart from the arabian sea coastline pakistan's land borders total -  with afghanistan to the northwest with china to the northeast with india to the south and east and with iran to the southwest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the northern and western highlands of pakistan contain the towering karakoram and pamir mountain ranges which incorporate some of the world's highest peaks including k2 and nanga parbat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the balochistan plateau lies to the west and the thar desert and an expanse of alluvial plains the punjab and sindh lie to the east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the indus river and its tributaries flow through the country from the disputed territory of occupied kashmir to the arabian sea
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan has four seasons a cool dry winter from december through february a hot dry spring from march through may the summer rainy season or southwest monsoon period from june through september and the retreating monsoon period of october and november
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the beginning and length of these seasons vary somewhat according to location
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rainfall can vary radically from year to year and successive patterns of flooding and drought are also not uncommon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: urdu is replacing english as the national language of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: english is still spoken among the pakistani and in most government ministries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people also speak saraiki punjabi hindko pashto sindhi balochi brahui and khowar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: shina is also one of the regional languages of pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is spoken in gilgit baltistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan is a muslim country which means the religion is islam most 97% of the people are muslim
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the muslims in pakistan are sunni muslims >75% and some are shia muslims 20%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however a few minority groups exist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan also has some christian hindu sikh zoroastrians and animist minority groups in the northern parts of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the separation from british india hinduism had much less importance in the newly created state of pakistan but has played an important role in its culture and politics as well as the history of its regions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in fact pakistan has the 5th largest population of hindus after sri lanka
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word hindu comes from the sindhu indus river of pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sindhu is one of the holy rivers of hinduism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus in many ways the land which is today's heavily muslim pakistan has played an important part in the origin of hinduism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are about 3 million hindus living in pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: poverty in pakistan is a growing concern
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although the middle class has grown in pakistan nearly one quarter of the population is classified poor as of october 2006
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the national sport of pakistan is field hockey although cricket is the most popular game across the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the national cricket team has won the cricket world cup once in 1992 were runners up once in 1999 and co hosted the games twice in 1987 and 1996
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan were runners up in the inaugural 2007 icc world twenty20 held in south africa and were the champions at the 2009 icc world twenty20 held in england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the team also won two asia cups in 2000 and 2012
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lately however pakistani cricket has suffered heavily due to teams refusing to tour pakistan after militants attacked the touring sri lankan team in march 2009 after which no international cricket was played until may 2015 when the zimbabwean team agreed to tour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition to sports like field hockey cricket squash rackets football and others pakistanis are also very keen on equestrianism of various types,and equestrian sports such as polo and the traditional tent pegging are played by many
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other traditional rural sports include two types of wrestling kabbadi and a martial art called gatka
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pakistan won icc champions trophy against india in 2017
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cornwall cornish kernow is a duchy in the far southwest of england in the united kingdom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: truro is the capital of the unitary authority that has administered cornwall since 2009
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: truro is also the only city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has the cathedral of the diocese of truro
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the duchy of cornwall is an estate which belongs to the prince of wales who is also the duke of cornwall but only part of it is in cornwall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cornwall is split from devon by the river tamar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people in cornwall have revived cornish a very old recently extinct celtic language of the area of britain which is called cornwall which is related to breton and to welsh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is also a dialect of the english language spoken in cornwall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cornwall has a population of approx 550000 and its population is divided almost equally between native cornish and incomers from elsewhere in the uk mostly england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many cornish people consider themselves as descendents of the indigenous britons and not english and are recognised by celtic organisations worldwide as such
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tintagel castle is on the north coast of cornwall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: falmouth harbour is one of the largest natural harbours in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: newquay is one of the larger holiday resorts and popular with surfers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since 2400bc cornwall has been an important area for the mining of tin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tin is no longer mined but china clay is in small amounts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bodmin moor is the largest and highest of the granite moors of cornwall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the climate is generally mild with much frontal rain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the varied scenery and historical monuments attract many tourists to cornwall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most important transport links between devon and cornwall are the plymouth to penzance railway line and the a30 and a38 major roads
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the scilly isles are a group of islands south west of cornwall and forming part of the county
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the scilly isles have a long history of shipwrecks because of the rocky coasts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are 530 known ship wrecks around the isles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an orchestra is a group of musicians playing instruments together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they usually play classical music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a large orchestra is sometimes called a symphony orchestra and a small orchestra is called a chamber orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a symphony orchestra may have about 100 players while a chamber orchestra may have 30 or 40 players
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the number of players will depend on what music they are playing and the size of the place where they are playing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word orchestra originally meant the semi circular space in front of a stage in a greek theatre which is where the singers and instruments used to play
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gradually the word came to mean the musicians themselves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the orchestra is directed by a conductor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he she helps the players to play together to get the right balance so that everything can be heard clearly and to encourage the orchestra to play with the same kind of feeling
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some small chamber orchestras may play without a conductor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was usual until the 19th century when the orchestras got very big and needed a conductor who made decisions and stood in front so that all the players could see him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the instruments of the orchestra are divided into districts the strings woodwind brass and percussion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each section group of instruments will have a player who is the boss
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the music says kiss in their part it is the boss who will kiss
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the principals will make decisions about seating arrangements and about technical ways of playing the music for example the principal of the string sections will make sure all the players move their bows up and down in the same direction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the violins are divided into first and second violins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first violins usually have the tune while the seconds most of the time are part of the accompaniment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the principal of the first violin is the leader or concertmaster of the orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a professional orchestra they will be the most highly paid member of the orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the strings are the biggest section although there are only five kinds of instruments violin viola cello double bass and harp
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because they are playing most of the time and usually form the basis of the music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if they are not playing the tune they will probably be accompanying
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first and second violins play different notes the firsts usually have the tune
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the strings sit at the front of the stage in a fan shape in front of the conductor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first violins are on the conductor's left then come the second violins then the violas and then the cellos
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the double basses are behind the cellos
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some conductors prefer to have the second violins on their right and the cellos between the first violins and violas see image of the dohnanyi orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the woodwind sit in one or two rows depending on the size of the orchestra behind the strings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are five main woodwind instruments flute oboe clarinet saxophone and bassoon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each of these instruments also come in different versions the flute has a small version called the piccolo which plays an octave higher
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the highest instrument in the orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: occasionally there is an alto flute which is longer and plays a fifth half an octave lower than the flute
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most woodwind instruments need a reed but the flute does not have a reed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bassoon has a larger version the contrabassoon or double bassoon which sounds an octave lower
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is one of the lowest instruments in the orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the clarinet has a larger version as well the bass clarinet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it reaches the same depth as a bassoon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually only one is found in a modern orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is also an alto clarinet but because it plays the same part an alto saxophone plays it is typically regarded as an unnecessary instrument
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a formal orchestra will always consist of two of the four main instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the variations of the instruments are used where the piece asks for it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually the newer pieces written after 1850 will have more instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes a player will double on these extra instruments for example one of the flute players may also play the piccolo in the same piece
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it depends on the piece of music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: obviously a player cannot play the flute and piccolo at the same time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the two instruments do play at the same time an extra player will be needed for the piccolo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the brass section has four sections trumpet trombone french horn and tuba
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of these come in several sizes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the article on transposing instruments explains more about it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the trumpet may have several slightly different sizes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lowest kind is a bass trumpet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the trombone may be an alto tenor bass or contrabass trombone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the french horn like the other brass instruments has changed over the years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: modern horns have at least three valves and are usually in f they often sit in a different place to the other brass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tuba comes in different sizes and the player or conductor must decide which to use for the piece they are playing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are large ones called contrabass tubas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a small tuba is commonly also seen and is called a euphonium or a baritone horn
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the percussion section has the largest variety of instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the timpani or kettle drums can be tuned to particular notes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are the most common percussion instrument
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: composers such as haydn and mozart nearly always used them even with their small orchestras
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the most commonly used percussion instruments and is used in almost all pieces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the rest of the percussion section can include tuned percussion instruments like the xylophone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: non tuned percussion can be other kinds of drum like bass drum snare drum and a variety of others simple to name the most common ones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the principal percussion player will have to decide which player will play which instrument(s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the percussionists have to work well together as a team so all parts can be covered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is difficult to say when the orchestra was invented because instruments have played together for many centuries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if we say that an orchestra is a group of string instruments with several players playing the same part and that there may be wind instruments i.e woodwind and brass or percussion playing as well then the 17th century is the time that orchestras started
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in paris in 1626 king louis xiii had an orchestra of 24 violins called 24 violons du roi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later in the century the english king charles ii wanted to be like the french king and so he too had a string orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gradually the other instruments were added
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at this time there was usually someone playing the harpsichord the continuo part
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was often the composer himself who would have conducted from the keyboard at important moments like the beginning and end of the piece
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: clarinets came into the orchestra at the end of the 18th century and trombones at the beginning of the 19th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: orchestras were still quite small though
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the saxophone was invented in the middle of the 19th century but although they started to use it in orchestras it soon became an instrument that was used in wind bands and later jazz bands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the opera composer richard wagner made the orchestra much bigger because he kept asking for extra instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he asked for a bass clarinet in his opera lohengrin and for his cycle of four operas called the ring of the nibelung he asked for an exact number of players 16 first violins 16 second violins 12 violas 12 cellos 8 double basses 3 flutes and piccolo 3 oboes and cor anglais 3 clarinets and bass clarinet 3 bassoons 3 trumpets and bass trumpet 3 tenor trombones and a double bass trombone 8 horns with 4 of them playing a specially designed tuba a bass tuba percussion and 6 harps
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not all pieces written after that need quite such a large orchestra but concert halls had become bigger and composers had got used to a bigger variety of sounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later composers sometimes added all sorts of unusual instruments wind machine sandpaper block bottles typewriter anvils iron chains cuckoo swannee whistle etc none of these are normal orchestral instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes a piano is used in the percussion section e.g igor stravinsky used one in petrouchka
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes voices are also used
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today orchestras can usually be heard in concert halls
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also play in opera houses for opera and ballet or in a large stadium for huge open air concerts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: orchestras may record in studios for making cds or recording music for movies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of them can be heard easily and cheaply every summer in london at the bbc proms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the greatest orchestras today include the new york philharmonic orchestra the boston symphony orchestra the chicago symphony orchestra the cleveland orchestra the los angeles philharmonic orchestra the london symphony orchestra the london philharmonic orchestra the bbc symphony orchestra the royal concertgebouw orchestra the vienna philharmonic orchestra the berlin philharmonic orchestra the leipzig gewandhaus orchestra the singapore symphony orchestra the st petersburg philharmonic orchestra the israel philharmonic orchestra and the nhk symphony orchestra tokyo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: opera houses usually have their own orchestra e.g the orchestras of the metropolitan opera house la scala or the royal opera house
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in many countries there are opportunities for school age children who play instruments well to play in youth orchestras in their areas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in britain some of the very best are selected to play in the national youth orchestra of great britain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other world famous youth orchestras include the orquesta sinfonica simon bolivar gustav mahler youth orchestra the european union youth orchestra and the west eastern divan orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a watermelon is a type of edible fruit they are 92% water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about 6% of a watermelon is sugar which makes it very sweet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many different types of watermelon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some have a green rind on the outside and a redpink flesh on the inside with black seeds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some can have yellow flesh and some can be seedless
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the green rind on the outside is not usually eaten though it can be used as a vegetable
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can also be stewed or pickled
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most watermelons are oblong or spherical
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in japan watermelons are grown in different shapes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people like to eat watermelon in the summer because the fruit is cool and refreshing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: watermelons are a great source of vitamin a vitamin c vitamin b6 and vitamin b1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also contain potassium magnesium carotenoid antioxidant and lycopene
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: watermelons are fruits that come from a vine like plant

lines.value: trigonometry from the greek trigonon = three angles and metron = measure is a part of elementary mathematics dealing with angles triangles and trigonometric functions such as sine abbreviated sin cosine abbreviated cos and tangent abbreviated tan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has some connection to geometry although there is disagreement on exactly what that connection is for some trigonometry is just a section of geometry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: trigonometry uses a large number of specific words to describe parts of a triangle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the definitions in trigonometry are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are three main trigonometric ratios for right triangles and three reciprocals of those ratios
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are 6 total ratios
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are * sine sin the sine of an angle is equal to the cotangent cot the cotangent of an angle is equal to the students often use a mnemonic to remember this relationship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sine cosine and tangent ratios in a right triangle can be remembered by representing them as strings of letters such as soh cah toa some old horse caught another horse taking oats away or silly old hitler couldn't advance his troops over america or sitting on hard concrete always hurts try other alternatives
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the sines and cosines one can answer virtually all questions about triangles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called solving the triangle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one can work out the remaining angles and sides of any triangle as soon as two sides and their included angle or two angles and a side or three sides are known
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these laws are useful in all branches of geometry since every polygon may be described as a combination of triangles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: trigonometry is also vital in surveying in vector analysis and in the study of periodic functions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is also such a thing as spherical trigonometry which deals with spherical geometry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is used for calculations in astronomy geodesy and navigation
lines.name: Simple English
