lines.value: an antenna or aerial is a metal device made to send or receive radio waves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many electronic devices like radio television radar wireless lan cell phone and gps need antennas to do their job
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: antennas work both in air and outer space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word antenna is from guglielmo marconi's test with wireless equipment in 1895
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for the test he used a 2.5 meter long pole antenna with a tent pole called ' l'antenna centrale ' in italian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so his antenna was simply called ' l'antenna '.
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after that the word antenna became popular among people and had the meaning it has today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the plural of antenna is either antennas or antennae us and canada tends to use antennas more than other places
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each one is made to work for a specific frequency range
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the antenna's length or size usually depends on the wavelength 1/frequency it uses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: different kinds of antenna have different purposes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example the isotropic radiator is an imaginary antenna that sends signals equally in all directions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dipole antenna is simply two wires with one end of each wire connected to the radio and the other end standing free in space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it sends or receives signals in all directions except where the wires are pointing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some antennas are more directional
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: horn is used where high gain is needed the wavelength is short
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: satellite television and radio telescopes mostly use dish antennas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ethnic cleansing is a type of crime against humanity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in an ethnic cleansing ethnic or religious groups are forced to leave an area by a more powerful ethnic group
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the goal of an ethnic cleansing is to get rid of everyone who does not belong to the more powerful ethnic group
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then the more powerful group can have the area they cleansed for themselves and only members of their group will live there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in an ethnic cleansing perpetrators may use different ways of getting rid of people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they may force people to move deport people them until they leave and use rape and mass murder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually the perpetrators will also try to destroy any signs that the victims lived in the area they are cleansing they may homes farms infrastructure monuments cemeteries and places of worship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the united nations defines ethnic cleansing this way experts say that ethnic cleansing is different than genocide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a genocide a group tries to kill every member of a certain group so that group no longer exists on the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in an ethnic cleansing the perpetrators are trying to get rid of other groups in specific areas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is no official legal definition of ethnic cleansing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however both the international criminal court icc and the international criminal tribunal for the former yugoslavia icty define deporting a population from its home as a crime against humanity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other crimes that happen during ethnic cleansing are treated as separate crimes that may fit under the definitions of genocide or crimes against humanity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example murdering raping and persecuting large groups of people are all crimes against humanity under the international criminal court's laws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during ancient and medieval history jewish people were victims of ethnic cleansing in many countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example around 1290 ad king edward i of england ordered all of the jews in the country to leave
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hundreds of elderly jews were executed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: next france and some german states did the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: finally in 1492 spain ordered its jews to convert to catholicism or leave the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: any jew who stayed in the country would be executed without a trial
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between 40000 and 100000 jews were forced to leave spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ten years later in 1502 spain also forced its muslims to leave the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 19th century the united states government committed an ethnic cleansing against native american tribes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at this time the united states was growing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people in the country wanted to take over what is now the southern united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however this land had always belonged to native american tribes like the cherokee nation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the early 1800s the united states government started a program of removing these tribes from the south
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the government wanted these tribes to move west outside the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: under andrew jackson the united states military took land away from creek and seminole indians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some tribes signed treaties and agreed to move
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however other tribes refused to leave the land that had always been theirs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1829 andrew jackson became president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the next year he signed the indian removal act
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jackson used this law to force tribes that were still in the south to leave the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cherokee nation refused to leave their homes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1838 president martin van buren ordered the military to force them to leave
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: p.41 soldiers forced about 15000 cherokees and 2000 of their slaves to leave their land
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at first the cherokees were all forced into internment camps where 353 cherokee died from diseases during one summer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pp.41-42 after that the cherokee were forced to walk from the south to what is now oklahoma and arkansas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most historians say that about 4000 people died on the way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was one out of every four people in the cherokee population
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because so many people died this forced migration is now called the trail of tears
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: syngman rhee or lee seungman or yee sung man (, march 26 1875 - july 19 1965 was a korean independence activist and politician
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the first president of south korea
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his presidency from august 1948 to april 1960 remains controversial affected by cold war tensions on the korean peninsula and elsewhere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee was a strong anti communist and led south korea through the korean war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his presidency ended in resignation following popular protests against a disputed election
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he died in exile in hawaii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee was born in whanghai province to rhee kyong sun a member of the aristocratic yangban family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee was descended from prince hyo nyong the second son of king taejong of joseon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he soon became active in korea's struggle against japanese control
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was arrested in 1897 for demonstrating against the monarchy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after he was released in 1904 he went to the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he obtained several degrees including a phd from princeton university
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he began writing his name in the western manner with the personal name before the family name
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when president theodore roosevelt was helping negotiations for the treaty of portsmouth rhee asked him to put freedom for korea in the treaty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this did not happen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1910 he went back to korea under japanese rule
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his political actions got him into trouble with the japanese army so he left for china in 1912
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1919 all of the major pro independence groups formed the provisional government of the republic of korea in shanghai
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee was elected the president a post he held until 1925 when he was removed by the provisional assembly for the misuse of his authority
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the end of world war 2 rhee returned to seoul
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was before the other independence leaders since he was the only one well known to the allies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1945 he was chosen as head of a provisional short term government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the unspoken agreement of the occupation authorities rhee conducted a number of actions to remove communism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was actually a hidden plan to remove all possible opposition to him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee was elected the first president of south korea on 10 may 1948 by a parliamentary vote
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he defeated kim koo the last president of the provisional government by 180 votes to 16
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all the left wing parties refused to take part in the election
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 15 august 1948 he formally took over from the us military and became the legal power over the korean people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as president rhee took on dictatorial powers even before the korean war started in 1950
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he allowed the internal security force headed by his right hand man kim chang ryong to put people in prison and torture them if they were thought to be communists or north korean agents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his government also directed several massacres the most famous being on the island of jeju
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was after an uprising by left wing groups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while massacres did occur under governments that came after rhee there were not as many and less widespread
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee made himself unpopular by telling the people in seoul to stay in the city when the korean war started
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had already left
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his decision to cut the bridges on the han river stopped thousands of people from escaping from the communists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the un and south korean forces fought back and drove the north koreans north towards the yalu river
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after a chinese counterattack they un and south korean were pushed back to the current dmz
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee became unpopular with the us and the un for refusing to agree to a number of peace plans that would have left korea divided
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wanted to become the leader of a united korea with un assistance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he tried to stop any peace plan that would not remove the northern government completely
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also argued for stronger military action to be used against china
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was annoyed because the us would not bomb china
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on january 18 1952 rhee declared south korean rule over the waters around the korean peninsula
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was an idea the same as today's exclusive economic zones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the new border which rhee called the peace line included tsushima island and the uninhabited islands named dokdo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this led to protests from the japanese government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they claimed that the islands were japanese territory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: minor clashes followed but the islands have been under south korean administration since then
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: throughout his rule rhee took extra steps to keep his control over the government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in may 1952 rhee pushed through constitutional changes which made the presidency a directly elected position
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to get this passed by parliament he declared martial law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he jailed the members of parliament he thought would vote against it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee was soon elected by a big majority
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he regained control of parliament in the 1954 elections
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he pushed through an amendment to exempt himself from the eight year limit on presidents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee's chances for reelection during the presidential campaign of 1956 seemed small
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people did not think he should be allowed to be president three times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main opposition candidate shin ik hee drew large crowds during his campaign
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: shin's sudden death during the campaign however allowed rhee to win the presidency with ease
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the runner up of that election cho bong am of the progressive party was later charged with spying and executed in 1959
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by 1960 rhee had already served three terms in office
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his next victory was certain after the main opposition candidate cho byeong ok died shortly before the march 15 elections
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee won with 90% of the vote
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the real contest was in the race for vice president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was held separately under the law of the time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yi gi bung who rhee thought should take over after him was declared the winner of an election that the opposition claimed was rigged
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this created anger among groups of the korean people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a student led april 19 movement forced rhee to resign on april 26
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on april 28 a dc 4 belonging to the cia operated civil air transport took rhee out of south korea
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was to rescue him from the angry crowds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kim yong kap rhee's deputy minister of finance revealed that president rhee had taken $20 million in government money for himself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee his austrian born wife francisca donner and adopted son lived in exile in honolulu hawaii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on july 19 1965 rhee died of a stroke
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his body was returned to seoul and buried in the national cemetery on july 27 1965
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee's legacy has been in considerable dispute
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in general conservative circles regard rhee as the patriarch of the nation while liberals tend to be critical of him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rhee's former residence in seoul ihwajang is currently used for the presidential memorial museum and woo nam presidential preservation foundation has been set up to honour his legacy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * syngman rhee

lines.value: argentina officially the argentine republic is a country in south america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentina is the second largest country in south america and the eighth largest country in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spanish is the language most people speak and the official language but many other languages are spoken
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are minorities speaking italian german english quechua and even welsh in patagonia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the capital city of the argentina is buenos aires one of the largest cities in the world in eastern argentina
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in order by number of people the largest cities in argentina are buenos aires cordoba rosario mendoza la plata tucuman mar del plata salta santa fe and bahia blanca
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentina is between the andes mountain range in the west and the southern atlantic ocean in the east and south
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is bordered by paraguay and bolivia in the north brazil and uruguay in the northeast and chile in the west and south
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also claims the falkland islands spanish islas malvinas and south georgia and the south sandwich islands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name argentina comes from the latin argentum silver as the spanish conquistadors believed the area had silver
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the americas canada us brazil and argentina are the largest countries in that order
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oldest signs of people in argentina are in the patagonia piedra museo santa cruz and are more than 13000 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1480 the inca empire conquered northwestern argentina making it part of the empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the northeastern area the guarani developed a culture based on yuca and sweet potato however typical dishes all around argentina are pasta red wines italian influence and beef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other languages spoken are italian english and german
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lunfardo is argentinean slang and is a mix of spanish and italian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentineans are said to speak spanish with an italian accent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentina declared independent from spain in 1816 and achieved it in a war led by jose de san martin in 1818
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many immigrants from europe came to the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the 1920s it was the 7th wealthiest country in the world but it began a decline after this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 1940s following the infamous decade where the country's politics were not stable juan peron came to power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: peron was one of the most important people in the country's history and many politicians today call themselves peronist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: peron was forced out of power in 1955
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after spending years in exile he returned to power in the 1970s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1976 the country was falling into chaos and the military took power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was not the first time the military had done this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: leading the new government was jorge rafael videla
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: videla was one of history's most brutal dictators
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thousands of people disappeared or were killed during his time as president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: videla retired in 1980
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of his successors was another general turned dictator leopoldo galtieri
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the time galtieri was in office in 1981 the dictatorship became unpopular
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to try to stir up support galtieri ordered an invasion of the falkland islands starting a war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentina lost the war and soon the country fell into chaos again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: galtieri was removed from power and eventually democracy was restored
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: galtieri and videla would be charged with crimes against humanity because of the mass murder and other crimes that they ordered as president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today argentina is one of the most important countries in latin america though it still has many problems facing it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a large economy and is an influential country in the southern cone of south america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentina is a federal republic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the people of argentina vote for a president to rule them and senators and deputies to speak for them and make laws for them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the president is mauricio macri since december 2015
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentina is divided into 23 provinces provincias singular provincia and 1 city commonly known as capital federal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentina is almost 3700 km long from north to south and 1400 km from east to west maximum values
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be divided into three parts the pampas in the central part of the country patagonia in the southern part down to tierra del fuego and the andes mountain range along the western border with chile with the highest point in the province of mendoza
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cerro aconcagua at 6960 metres 22834 ft is the americas highest mountain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most important rivers include the river plate paraguay bermejo colorado uruguay and the largest river the parana
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: river plate was incorrectly translated though and should have been translated to english as river of the silver
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: river plate is also a famous buenos aires soccer team
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: see list of cities in argentina for the many places people live in argentina
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the majority of the argentineans are descendants of europeans mainly from spain italy germany ireland france other europeans countries and mestizo representing more than 90% of the total population of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: football or soccer is the most popular sport although the national sport of the country is pato
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentina has a number of highly ranked polo players
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: field hockey for women rugby and golf are also favorites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentina is a christian country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of argentina's people 80 percent are roman catholic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: argentina also has the largest population of jewish community after israel and us
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many middle eastern immigrants who were muslims converted to catholicism but there are still muslims as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: medicine is socialized and so is education making argentina's literacy rate about 98%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: state university is free as well

lines.value: a para rubber tree or simply rubber tree is the tree which naturally produces rubber
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is native to tropical areas from south america in the amazon brazil but was spread by european farmers to the far east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: para rubber trees belong to the euphorbiaceae family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the wild they may reach heights of 100 to 125 ft 30-38 m with large cylindrical trunks with or without buttresses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: crop trees reach a width of about 20 in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 50 cm usually with a short bole and with a sloped taper
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most rubber plantation s are in south asia and southeast asia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when trees reach 5-6 years old they are harvested
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their trunks are cut just deep enough to tap the vessels without harming the tree's growth and the sap is collected in small buckets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this process is known as rubber tapping
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: older trees produce more latex but they stop producing it after 26-30 years

lines.value: caenorhabditis elegans is a species of roundworm or nematode
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is important because much research has been done on its genetics and development
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: c elegans is about 1 mm long
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the worms are not parasites they are free living
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they live in soil and feed on bacteria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: c elegans is a model organism used to study animal development and behavior
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the first multicellular organism for which scientists have been able to sequence its whole genome
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: c elegans has two types of sex hermaphrodite and male
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a hermaphrodite makes sperms when its in a larval stage and makes ova in an adult stage
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a male can only make sperm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: males are a little smaller than hermaphrodites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: study using c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: elegans was begun in 1965 by sydney brenner
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in laboratories they are easy to keep alive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at 25c they spend 14 hours as an embryo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: animals like c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: elegans that do not take long to grow and are easy to feed are usually good organisms for research
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2002 the nobel prize for medicine was awarded to sydney brenner robert horvitz and john sulston for their work on how c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: elegans's genes cause it to grow and cause some of its cells to die
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: grace kelly november 12 1929 september 14 1982 was an american actress
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she later married prince rainier iii of monaco and became her serene highness the princess of monaco
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with prince rainier she had 3 children kelly suffered a stroke which caused her to crash her car

lines.value: george washington february 22 1732 - december 14 1799 was the first president of the united states 1789-1797 the commander in chief of the continental army during the american revolutionary war and one of the founding fathers of the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: washington's mother was mary ball and his father was augustine washington
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they owned a plantation with slaves in virginia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: george studied at local schools in fredericksburg and was also homeschooled for part of his life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: george's mother was unfit to care for him and his father died when he was 11 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: washington became a farmer like his father
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his plantation was called mount vernon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also worked as a surveyor measuring land
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: washington always aspired to be a soldier and was active in the colonial militia of virginia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was sent several times to the forks of the ohio river now called pittsburgh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his job was to get rid of the french who were trying to take control of the ohio country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he failed and many of his men were killed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fight opened the french and indian war bringing britain into the seven years war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1759 washington married a widow named martha custis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the marriage produced no children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: washington was a delegate to the first continental congress which was created by the thirteen colonies to respond to various laws passed by the british government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second continental congress chose him to be the commanding general of the continental army
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: washington led the army from 1775 until the end of the war in 1783
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after losing the big battle of long island and being chased across new jersey washington led his troops back across the delaware river on christmas day 1776 in a surprise attack on hessian mercenaries at the small battle of princeton and trenton new jersey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the british had more troops and more supplies than washington however washington kept his troops together and won these small battles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: overall washington did not win many battles but he never let the british destroy his army
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with the help of the french army and navy washington made a british army surrender at yorktown virginia in 1781 in the final major battle of the war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the war officially ended with the treaty of paris in 1783
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the revolutionary war ended washington was considered a national hero
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was offered a government position that would have been considered a dictatorship over the colonies but in a surprising move washington refused left the army and returned to mount vernon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wanted the colonies to have a strong government but did not wish to head that government nor did he want the colonies to be run by a tyrant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few years later washington was called upon to host the discussions for the new government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was voted president of the constitutional convention in 1785
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: washington wanted the states to ratify the constitution of the united states and they did largely thanks to the federalist papers which were written by alexander hamilton john jay and james madison
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1789 washington was elected president without any competition making him the first president of the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while washington did not belong to any political party he agreed with certain federalist policies such as the country having a standing army and a national bank
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was reelected to a second term
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after his second term washington decided not to run for reelection despite his popularity remaining high
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his decision set a precedent that every president followed until franklin d roosevelt in 1940
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in washington's farewell address he warned the country not to divide into political parties and to not get involved in wars outside of the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: washington's non intervention foreign policy was supported by most americans for over one hundred years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his advice concerning political parties was completely ignored as parties were already forming at the time of his speech
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: washington went back home to mount vernon after his second term ended in 1797
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he died on december 14 1799 in mount vernon at the age of 67 from pneumonia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from his marriage george washington owned a substantial amount of farm land where he grew tobacco wheat and vegetables
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: washington also owned more than 100 slaves who were freed upon his death
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he did not have much money in cash and had to borrow money while he was president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at his death washington's estate was worth over $500000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a common misconception that george washington had wooden teeth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he did however try many different ways to replace his teeth including having teeth carved from elk's teeth or ivory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ivory and bone both have hairline fractures in them which normally can't be seen but started to darken due to washington's love of wine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the darkened thin fractures in the bone made the lines look like the grain in a piece of wood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: george washington's teeth started falling out when he was about 22 years old and he had only one tooth left by the time he became president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was difficult for him to talk and to eat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at one time he had fake teeth with a special hole so the one tooth he still had could poke through he tried to keep them smelling clean by soaking them in wine but instead they became mushy and black
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1796 a dentist had to pull out george washington's last tooth and he kept his tooth in a gold locket attached to his watch chain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the time came for the president to have his portrait painted cotton was pushed under his lips to make him look as if he had teeth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cotton made his mouth puff out as is seen on the picture on the dollar bill
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: samba is a kind of music dancing and singing originally from brazil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it began as a music dance movement in the 1920s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: samba is a lively rhythmical dance of brazilian origin in 2/4 time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in ballroom dance there are three steps to every bar making the samba feel something like a 3/4 timed dance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the timing is one a two with the values about one beat 1/4 beat 3/4 beat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two main types of samba that differ from each other the modern ballroom samba and the traditional samba of brazil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: traditional brazilian samba includes the samba which is danced solo at carnival
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in that case the dancers take just one step on each beat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ballroom samba has its origins in brazil at the beginning of the 20th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many steps can be traced back to the maxixe danced in 1910s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a book published in france in 1928 already described how to perform the samba
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the modern ballroom dance was created in england mostly with steps adapted from those seen in brazil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this version is now danced all over the world in international competitive dancing as regulated by the world dance council
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ballroom samba like other ballroom dances is a form adapted for its suitability as a partner dance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dance movements which do not change depending on the style of samba music being played borrows some movements from afro brazilian traditional dances such those used in candomble rituals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ballroom samba is danced to music in 2/4 time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the basic movements are counted either 1-2 or 1-a-2 and are danced with a slight bouncing action
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this action is created through the bending and straightening of the knees with bending occurring on the beats of 1 and 2 and the straightening occurring on the a
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: samba is notable for its constantly changing rhythms however with cross rhythms being a common feature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus common step values in beats are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the following applies to the type of samba done during street carnivals where the musicians will move along with the dancers sometimes on foot sometimes on a motorized float or platform
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the music is played with different instruments - bass drums a surdo drum used for keeping a steady beat snare drums a whistle called an apito [a-peet-oh] used for beginning and ending sections of music other types of untuned percussion and different varieties of bells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other sections are when the apito blasts one rhythm and all other instruments respond using another rhythm that lasts the same amount of time as the first named a call and response section and a samba piece can have instrument solos when one instrument is playing an exciting rhythm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the apito caller signals the end of one section and the beginning of the next by blasting a short call
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pieces always have clear beginnings and ends
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ballroom sambas are usually played by standard ballroom dance bands with one or two extra percussion instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: viktor fedorovych yanukovych () born 9 july 1950 is a ukrainian politician who was the 4th president of ukraine from 2010 to 2014 he was prime minister of ukraine from november 2002 until december 2004 he was forced to resign leave office early on 31 december 2004
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he again was prime minister of ukraine from 4 august 2006 until 18 december 2007
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is the former leader of the party of regions the biggest political party of ukraine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the party was formerly part of the ukrainian government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in november 2004 he won the presidential election
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: viktor yushchenko his opponent said the result was false
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: large daily demonstrations supporting viktor yushchenko followed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were named the orange revolution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ukrainian judges decided that there would be new elections in december 2004
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: victor yuschenko won those elections and became president of ukraine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yanukovych was supported by vladimir putin of russia and by the former ukrainian president leonid kuchma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yushchenko claimed to have been poisoned in a bid to silence his orange power base
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: certainly he was hospitalized and his appearance showed signs of a grave illness
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in february 2010 he won the presidential election yulia tymoshenko who lost the election with a 3.48% difference said he won because of fraud
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yanukovych was a victim of poverty in his childhood and was twice put in prison for violent crimes in his youth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after mass protest in ukraine during february 2014 yanukovych was forced out of office on 22 february 2014
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: oleksandr turchynov became acting president

lines.value: fire is a chemical reaction that gives off light and heat

lines.value: fire is also very dangerous because it can cause houses trees and many other things to burn into ashes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: forest fires are very harmful

lines.value: they can destroy a huge area in a matter of minutes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fires hurt almost more than a thousand people a year

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many other ways as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some camps there is a camp fire around the camp fire there are usually some logs to stop it from spreading
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fire can also be made with the sun's energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fire can be very useful if it is treated carefully
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has always been very important for people to be able to make fire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people need its heat on cold days
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also used to cook things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its light is also useful to be able to see in dark places
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fire is very hot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a person should never touch fire because fire may burn anything that gets too close
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if human skin touches fire the skin may burn which can take some time to heal

lines.value: if a fire gives off a lot of smoke a person's mouth should be covered with a wet cloth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if one breathes too much smoke in it is possible to faint
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fuel s should not come near fire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if fire is not treated carefully it can be very dangerous

lines.value: one wildfire sometimes burns thousands of square miles or kilometers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: forests can burn down if fires are not controlled
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: every year large areas of forests are destroyed because of fire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this usually happens in the summer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: firefighters are people with special training to control and stop fires fire needs three things to burn oxygen fuel and heat

lines.value: fuels can be wood tinder coal oil or any other substance that will easily oxidize

lines.value: once a fire is burning it creates its own heat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this lets the fire keep burning on its own for some time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a fire can be stopped in three different ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fires are usually combustion reactions that take carbon hydrogen and oxygen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the products are very commonly water and carbon dioxide although there are other examples that avoid this generalization such as burning magnesium in air which makes magnesium oxide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fires can occur in many ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many types of fire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are wood fires gas fires metal fires and more
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: wood fires can usually be put out with water because water absorbs heat but metal fires are too hot for water to absorb enough heat to put out the fire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if water is used to extinguish put out a metal fire the water will simply evaporate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for metal fires sand can be used to cover the fire and keep it from obtaining oxygen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a fire extinguisher can put out most fires
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in mathematics a product is a number or a quantity obtained by multiplying two or more numbers together

lines.value: for example 4 x 7 = 28 here the number 28 is called the product of 4 and 7
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the nobel peace prize is one of six awards in the memory of alfred nobel the inventor of dynamite
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: every year the organization gives out six awards for the people who best benefit mankind through their actions in one of the six subjects peace literature physics chemistry economics and medicine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the peace prize is given out in norway but the other prizes are given out in sweden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because norway and sweden were one country when the prizes were started
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its list of winners includes martin luther king jr elihu root theodore roosevelt woodrow wilson henri la fontaine mikhail gorbachev aung san suu kyi nelson mandela kofi annan jimmy carter wangari maathai barack obama and liu xiaobo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is often a lot of controversy about the award of the prize
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 2013 winner is the organisation for the prohibition of chemical weapons making it the second year in a row that an organization has won the prize after the european union did so in 2012
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: here are the winners of the nobel peace prize

lines.value: yugoslavia was a country in europe mostly in balkan peninsula its meaning south slavs deriving from slavs who came from area what is now poland in 7th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it existed in three forms during 1918 2006
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from 1918 until 1928 it was called the kingdom of the serbs croats and slovenes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from 1928 until world war ii it was the kingdom of yugoslavia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after ww 2 it was renamed to the socialist federal republic of yugoslavia with six republics 2 autonomous provinces bosnia herzegovina croatia macedonia montenegro serbia and slovenia and two autonomous provinces in serbia vojvodina in the north and kosovo next to albania
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1991 came the independence of slovenia croatia in 1992 macedonia bosnia and herzegovina causing the end of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: serbia and montenegro were the last two republics in the socialist yugoslavia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1992 they formed a new federal republic of yugoslavia fry which fell in 2006
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1903 the serbian king was murdered and replaced with peter i after this serbia became more nationalist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tensions with austria hungary heightened when it conquered bosnia in 1908
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during this period serbia managed to extend its borders and capture kosovo and macedonia from the ottoman empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many serbian nationalists wanted to create a unified state for the slavs of the balkans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: covert gangs attempted to assassinate austro hungarian officials like the bosnian governor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in june 1914 a bosnian serb called gavrilo princip killed austrian archduke franz ferdinand in sarajevo bosnia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this event eventually led to the outbreak of the great war world war one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yugoslavia came into existence in 1918 after world war i most of its northern territories were given to it from austria hungary when it collapsed during the war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: southern territories were taken by serbia from the ottoman empire during the balkan wars 1912-13
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reigning king in serbia became the king of all yugoslavia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for ten years it was known as the kingdom of serbs croats and slovenes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it began using the name yugoslavia in 1929
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name yugoslavia is serbo croatian for land of the southern slavs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kingdom was invaded by axis powers in 1941 and quickly fell during world war ii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a federal democratic republic was declared in 1943 with the king's approval but the monarchy was abolished shortly after
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a people's republic was created in 1945 by a newly established communist government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was ruled by josip tito from then until 1980
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the country renamed itself sfr yugoslavia in 1963
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was made up of six individual socialist republics sr croatia sr bosnia and herzegovina sr macedonia sr montenegro sr serbia and sr slovenia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sfr yugoslavia was different to other socialist states of the cold war deciding to keep itself out of it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yugoslavia was the only socialist state to have open borders and allowed yugoslavs and tourists to freely move around the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yugoslavia also kept warm relations with the west
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was also an enemy of the soviet union after the tito stalin split as stalin considered him a traitor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1968 the soviet union invaded socialist czechoslovakia to stop its leader from making the country more free
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tito told the czechoslovak leader that he was willing to fly to prague to help him face the soviets if he wanted
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the yugoslav republics began turning against one another in the 1970s and 1980s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: josip tito ruled yugoslavia with an iron fist and crushed any nationalist movements that wanted to see the country break up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his government forced the six republics to stay part of yugoslavia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he died in 1980 the new leaders were less strict and let nationalist feelings to grow in the republics of yugoslavia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the breakup was caused by many things like nationalism economic difficulty and ethnic problems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the socialist state was dissolved in 1992 during the yugoslav wars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: serbia and montenegro stayed together as fr yugoslavia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the dissolution of the sfr yugoslavia only serbia and montenegro were willing to remain in union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they renamed themselves the federal republic of yugoslavia in 1992
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the country was led by the controversial statesman slobodan milosevic from 1997 until 2000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was widely accused of having his opposition assassinated in 2000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yugoslavia applied for un membership in october 2000 and was granted the following month
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for most of its existence the country was involved with what was called the yugoslav wars
lines.name: Simple English
